碗
在耶穌的時代，在以色列各地都會有碗的存在。這些碗各有特色，無論是社會上不同身份和地位的人都會用得到，從普通的黏土，以稀有和美麗的玻璃也有。

陶器
在耶穌的時代，以色列裡一切的器皿幾乎都是陶器所做的。它被用作為炊具，以及儲存食品，酒類，硬幣，和書卷。

燈
燈是提供給那些需要光的人。古老的燈是都是簡單的再盆滿缽滿油。設置這種油燃燒著可以照亮一間房子幾個小時甚麼到一天，直到石油燒乾了。

羊圈
發現迷途的羔羊後，那裡有許多慶祝！
看耶穌的洗禮，並與施洗約翰交談！
與加利利的漁民，西門和安得烈見面！
雖然在以色列的生活甚艱苦，但人們都在紛紛討論著施洗約翰。 到底約翰是“那等待已久的彌賽亞”，還是 “在曠野有人聲喊著，預備主的道，修直他的路”的那位呢？
你聽到天上有聲喊著，“這是我的兒子！”這到底意味著什麼？
見證一個奇蹟後，您想了解更多......讓我們去跟施洗約翰談話，找出到底發生了什麼事。
加利利漁民1
你的家鄉在幾週內都沒有任何新鮮的魚！與您的朋友利百加往加利利去找出的問題是什麼。
修理西門和安得烈的船......然後看著他們跟耶穌碰面！
加利利漁民2
把船修理完後，西門和安得烈的開船出海並拉出一個大魚網。
帶你的魚回家，然後前往迦那來參加一場婚禮。
一位猶太教祭司－拉比正在城內教導，每個人都在談論他。你也去看看吧！
在迦那的婚禮1
你的朋友亞倫正主辦著一場在迦那的巨大的婚禮派對。這是他兒子的婚禮......確保它一定成功啊！
這場婚禮應該是要精彩的......但酒能維持到最後嗎？
在迦那的婚禮2
新郎和新婦的朋友從各方遠道而來參加這美妙的婚宴， 亞倫當然要當個很棒的主人咯！
婚禮的酒已用完了！耶穌能做甚麼嗎？
在迦那的婚禮3
耶穌已同意幫助亞倫。但是，現在他需要你的幫助。他奇怪的要求可能會產生結果！他到底正盤算什麼呢？

在你的生活中獲得能量
回答這四挑問題，並得到免費能量包！
不斷探索！
回答四個簡單的問題後繼續玩短的故事！
兩千年前，當西門航行在海上，一個漁夫的專業並不是”很流行”。這是一個骯髒的工作，有著不穩定的工作時間，而且你身上也會散發出魚腥味。儘管在遊戲裡修補魚網看起來很好還，實際上這工作也不簡單。
但是有一天，遇到臭氣的漁民，西門，耶穌，我們知道今天耶穌。從那天起，西蒙的生活從來都不是一樣的。耶穌說：“跟我來。”沒有第二個想法，西門走了一切，他的生活，直到這一點。他離開了船，網，跟從了耶穌。
這相遇改變了西蒙的生活，直到永遠。他不再是個打魚的。相反，他成了耶穌的左右手，所有時間最喜愛和討厭的人之一。西蒙是躍躍欲試，大膽倍，經常衝動。 “耶穌給了西蒙一個新的名字：彼得，這意味著”岩石。
通過一連串的事件，彼得耶穌的追隨者成為了一個主要領導人。前漁民在成千上萬的人面前發言，從地方到另一個地方分享他的經驗，並已閱讀數以百萬計的人甚至直到今天寫信。
今天，你覺得像西門，漁民定義的情況下，你的控制之外嗎？
也許這是你的年齡，你的家庭，你的工作。你喜歡的人，以不同的方式看你比他們做的嗎？
你有信心你是誰，因為你的能力，對未來的樂觀嗎？
你見過耶穌的人提供了一個新的身份？

我正在玩GAMENAME！
我每一天都在探索GAMENAME，並得到獎金。與我一起走在耶穌的道路上吧！
每天都有一個新的獎金！在加利利的路徑與我同行！
馬太福音6:9-11：“禱告，因此，像這樣......我們日用的飲食，’今日’賜給我們。”
我因每天都玩 GAMENAME，所以得到一個獎金。快來和我一起跟隨耶穌！
馬太福音6:34“所以不會為明天憂慮。因為明天自有明天的憂慮，一天的難處一天當就夠了。”
從朋友寄來的訊息
耶穌受洗
施洗約翰為耶穌洗禮！
耶穌被施洗約翰替他洗禮！天開了，聖靈像鴿子降在他身上。
耶穌被施洗約翰替他洗禮！天開了，聖靈像鴿子降在他身上。
新增金條和金幣
FIRSTNAME是證人
FIRSTNAME喜歡看精彩的事情，並觀看在神的作工。快來看看神在GAMENAME的工作。
見證奇蹟
FIRSTNAME是一個懷疑論者
如果沒有一個很好的理由，FIRSTNAME並不相信。有些人可能會說，他們缺乏信心，但也許他們太小心了。來GAMENAME自己親眼看吧。
尋求真理！
FIRSTNAME是一個學者
FIRSTNAME只用自己頭腦上的知識來跟隨神，並精通所有聖經中的道理。朋友們可以指望他們對聖經的知識。體驗在GAMENAME的聖經故事。
按照“聖經”！
FIRSTNAME是個跟隨者
FIRSTNAME是對神非常忠心虔誠的。儘管他們並不總知道祂要引領你往哪裡去，他們卻仍然用全心跟隨耶穌。來GAMENAME跟從耶穌。
跟隨耶穌！
FIRSTNAME 是奮銳黨
FIRSTNAME是熱心於自己的信仰...和一切事物！他們喜歡當下解決問題。你在GAMENAME會作出什麼選擇呢？
選擇熱心！
FIRSTNAME是和平締造者
FIRSTNAME知道神是愛。他們是一個醫治者，為別人解決衝突和播種和平的人。來與FIRSTNAME促進和平。
選擇和平！

Hi, PNAME! I'm Elijah, and I need your help.^Our town was once prosperous, until we were attacked by Roman bandits.^The town has never been the same…
Thanks for your help, PNAME.^Together, we can make a difference and bring healing to our town!
重建
Help Elijah rebuild the town and restore hope to your people.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
A fisherman in town has had a rough time ever since the attack.^He's out of jars and bowls. We should craft some for him.
Some of the people here are still bitter about what happened.^We can show them forgiveness one person at a time, starting with this fisherman.
Craft Jars and Bowls for the Fisherman who has fallen on hard times.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Make Jars and Bowls in your Kiln. Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
Make NEED Ceramic Bowl
The fisherman's house was destroyed by the bandits.^Let's prepare materials for a new house for him!
Thanks to your clay, the walls will be patched up.^The fisherman is still having trouble forgiving the Romans...
Building Preparations
Start gathering materials so you can rebuild the Fisherman's House.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Craft Clay in your Kiln. Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
We still need a few more things for the Fisherman's House.
We're bringing hope to this town. I know one day the fisherman will forgive the Romans.
More Supplies
Craft Planks and Bricks to stockpile more supplies for the Fisherman's House.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Make Planks in your Workshop and Bricks in your Kiln. Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
Everyone is so angry at the Romans. But not all Romans are bad!^Let's gather food to feed the homeless in our town.
This food will help feed the homeless in our town.^Maybe this will remind our town that God desires mercy, not revenge.
Help the Homeless
Feed the homeless in your town and show the people God's mercy.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
When the bandits attacked, the road was cracked and now there are potholes everywhere!
Your clay and metal has covered the potholes.^The road to the fisherman's house is smooth again!
Pothole Problems
Help cover the potholes in the old road! You will need Metal and Clay.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Make Metal in your Workshop and Clay in your Kiln. Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
I offered to feed anyone who volunteers to help rebuild the house.^Can you bring me some food?
I can feel the God's presence changing this town.^Maybe we can finally move on.^Thanks for providing the food for the volunteers.
Will Work for Food
Gather food for the volunteers.
Awesome work! Things are turning around.
Complete this task and earn a Gold Star!
The fisherman is sick!^How about we bring the fisherman a gift?

搜索土堆下的隱藏的恩賜。
有一個聲音聲喊著：“在曠野預備YHWH的道路”
感謝[先生夫人]！你人真好！
你也要在這裡洗禮嗎？
我一直在尋找與很多男人間的愛，然而我依然感到空虛...我只從我的過去中得釋放。
你詛咒羅馬人應該離開這裡！你一切你碰都要被摧毀！
你這猶太人習慣事實吧，這是羅馬的土地！閉上你的嘴！
我的希伯來弟兄是正確的。你們羅馬人應該離開！
你們犬類和你們一文不值的宗教！了解你的地方，並給羅馬榮耀吧！
你這蛇類！審判日要來臨了，但你認為你能逃脫它嗎？
一個聲音在呼喊：“在沙漠中清除YHWH的路！”
一個聲音在呼喊：“在曠野清除YHWH的路！”
有人在喊：“在沙漠中預備主的路，為耶和華我們的神修直祂的路！” - 以賽亞書40:3 公元前700年
這是怎麼回事？
這些人正在等待接受洗禮......嘿PNAME，你看，這孩子要什麼？
我來是要受洗，但我忘了收拾午餐了。我餓了。請[先生|小姐]，你能幫我嗎？
我有一些額外的食物，你拿去吧。
我有一些額外的食物，你拿去吧。
這個施洗約翰是誰？
約翰，你為什麼叫我們”這群蛇類”呢？
因為你滑行到河邊以為你會改變，因為你的皮膚變濕了。不！是你的生命要有所改變才行！
約翰，我是一個稅吏。我該怎麼辦？
你應該只拿你需要。不要搶別人的。
是的，沒錯！把我的錢從你手上放開！
你是救世主嗎？
我不是。我不是光。但我是被送來為光作見證的。
你想要得到洗禮，我的[兄弟姊妹]？
是的，我需要這個。
所以，來潔淨。並要悔改。
每個人都在談論他，PNAME。^有人說他是一個先知，有些人則認為他是個瘋子......你自己去看看吧。
不，我不確定我該不該相信這些東西......
我來叫你是希望你能重新審察自己的生命。
看，上帝的羔羊！
他是嗎？也許他能幫助我？
謝謝你...我需要這個。謝謝你的關心。
很寒冷啊！
我們試圖起火，但卻不能把它點燃。
這激進的約翰，想要推翻我們的整個社會！他是很危險的......
看這些所有骯髒的低階層人們。他們永遠不會得潔淨的…
他是誰？
他是先知以利亞從死裡復活！
不，我不是以利亞。但我在這裡為您預備...為別人…
這是一個不錯的地方，收集石頭。我想建立一個關於這些事件的馬賽克。
這些瘋子認為他們可以就這樣更改我們世紀以來的傳統...並不是我有什麼做…
你知道，我錯了。我講太多了。我從你偷了這，對不起。
我接受你的道歉。讓我們原諒並讓它過去吧。
你騙子！遠離我！
這一切都不適用於我。我是羅馬人，我只敬拜我自己的神！
世上只有一位神。當你要與他面對面前，先轉換你的生命吧。別再向人勒索錢了。
約翰，誰是那個你叫”羔羊”的人？
這是耶穌。我用水給你們施洗，但他會用火和聖靈為你們施洗。
這實在是太荒謬了。我們的傳統告訴我們，我們需要遵循留給我們的律法和傳統，我們就不會有錯了。
你錯了。世界上所有的習俗慣例也救不了你。你需要的是一改變你的心。
PNAME，剛剛出現的那新的男子...我以前有見過他嗎？
約翰，這傢伙不就是你表弟嗎？
你不知道他其實是誰。我甚至也不配為耶穌解開涼鞋。
我一直為這些人施洗，但你不是應該替我施洗嗎？
現在，我們一定要以這方法做，因為這是上帝的神聖的計劃。
“耶穌受洗”
你在水中花了多少時間不要緊！你仍然是一個骯髒的妓女！
不，我的女兒。你是活著的上帝的一位孩子
我的洗禮是奇妙的。你覺得呢？
在我們繼續之前，你應該與克洛伊和施洗約翰談談。
我不想受洗，但我想你做了。你覺得怎麼樣啊？
整個就像是有一重擔離開了我的肩膀。我得自由了。我再也不需要男人讓自我感覺良好。
你在水中花了多少時間不要緊！你仍然是一個骯髒的妓女！
不，我的女兒。你是活著的上帝的一位孩子
我正要找一些鵝卵石，以建立一個馬賽克。你能幫我嗎？
是的，[先生|我的夫人]。我相信那裡有一些在石榴樹的旁邊。
剛剛發生什麼事了？
這不可能是從耶和華來的標誌。根本是不可能的！
這是可怕的......但卻又令人興奮！
路得，你有看到我所看到的嗎？
當然，PNAME。有關於這個人......我想我可能很久前已經遇過到他。
這是甚麼樣的神啊？！我不懂…
這是一個從神來的神蹟。
我不知道，但它是相當奇妙的
那個男人是誰？
我想我需要重新思考我的生命。
神的國就在這裡！
那個男人...他去哪兒了？
YHWH帶領他到曠野。他需要單獨一會兒。
這可能是我們一直在期盼的。一個帶領叛亂反對羅馬的救世主，！
PNAME，總是會有不好的時候。救世主能拯救我們嗎？有傳言說，他正在這裡為人們施洗！

這條線是不必要的。

感謝你與我一起玩。

Wow, fresh bread! I'm grateful.

How kind of you!

It's the perfect night for cooking outside! Bring me some bricks so I can make a small oven.
Thanks for the bricks. I can already taste my baked chicken.
I can't sleep with an empty stomach!
Goodnight, friend! That snack was delicious.

This man does everything well!^He does what no one has done before!

This man could change the world with his power.^Maybe your Jewish God is what I've been looking for all my life.

Quick thinking with those wedge branches!

I'll have a bright light tonight!

I'll try the other side of town.

Hey, thanks a lot. That was very kind.
Do you have anything to eat?

Bless you, friend! He'll walk again soon.
Yeshua is just over there. He can heal your blindness.

You're very nice. Thank you for the juice.

The Kingdom of Heaven is here, if you will believe.

The flowers are stunning!
Zechariah, they're arguing about what to name your son. I know you can't speak.^But please come and write down what we should name him.
His name is John.
We're out of wine for our guests!
Your friends have wonderful taste. This wine is superb!
I'm so happy for Zechariah and Elizabeth!^I want to make them a clay pot, but I don't have any clay...
Thanks, I can get started right away on a present.
this guy should be undiggable
this guy should be undiggable
His name will be John.
When I mopped the floor, I missed a few spots. Can you help?
The floors are shining!
We are washing all our stockings. We need to hang them out to dry.
Well done, PNAME. Thank you.
No, his name is John.
Yes, we should name him after his father, Zechariah.
But no one in your family line has been named John!
PNAME, go find Zechariah.^He has been mute since he became high priest and entered the Holy of Holies.^But maybe he can write down what he wants to name his son.
Praise be to the God of Israel!^You, my child, will be a Prophet of the Most High.^You will prepare the way of the Lord, and bring his people the knowledge of salvation!
Blessed is the Lord God!^He knew his son's name without hearing, and now he can speak again!^What kind of man will this child become?
You won't believe what happened!^A few days ago, and angel of God visited me...
I'm collecting mistletoe for a winter redecorating.
You picked a lot of mistletoe. Thanks!
Can you spare some bread? Times have been hard on me.
Thank you! God bless.
You Jews have been revolting too much lately.^Make me some soup and I'll let you go!
Well done, Jew. You can pass... for now.
I'm cooking dinner for old Elizabeth.^Did you know, she's pregnant even in her old age!
Thanks for the cooking pot. I'll get started on dinner right away.
I'm hanging mistletoe outside my house as a decoration.
Wonderful! My wife will love this!
My horses are going to be in a parade! Can you help decorate them?
Those flower wreaths are splendid!
I haven't had fish in a long time...
Wow! This fish is so moist and delicious.^I love fried fish!
Elizabeth is with child even in her old age!^She's just like Abraham's wife, Sarah!^We need to celebrate with trumpets!
We'll have a party tonight!
I need a present to congratulate Elizabeth on her baby.
This jewelry is very pretty. She will love this!
I need to set the table for dinner at Elizabeth's house.^I can't find any bowls.
These bowls are perfect! It's such a blessing that she's going to have a baby!
Here's some paper so you can communicate with us, even though you can't speak.
i say something to end the map, i'm pregnant
Peace to you and your baby, Elizabeth.
Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child you bear!^But why is the mother of our Lord visiting me?^As soon as you spoke, my baby was filled with the Spirit, and he leapt in my womb!
My spirit rejoices in God my Savior, for now all generations will call me blessed.^His mercy to those who fear Him, from generation to generation!
What does that say? Come in? Ok, I'll come in.
This town is Magadan. We've never been here, but I hope they can recieve Yeshua's good news.^Peter is preparing for us at the inn. You should see if he needs anything.
I can't do my work with all these unclean sea creatures on the beach!
Wonderful! Now I can finish today's fishing.
A famous Pharisee is coming to my house for dinner.^I can't make a good impression with my shabby tableware...
Oh, bless you! I wouldn't want to insult a famous Rabbi.
Those self-righteous Pharisees are in town. They knocked over my food cart.^Do you have something I can use to clean up the spill?
This sawdust should dry up the spill from my food cart. Thank you.
If I don't deliver two perfume jars to my client today, I'll lose my contract!
You saved me! Honestly, these Sadducees are obsessed with fashion...^Who are they trying to impress? The Romans?
You're not from around here... Maybe you're a dock worker?^I need help loading my grain in that cart.
You're quite strong to lift all that grain! Are you sure you aren't a sailor?
Many of the Roman soldiers are coming to me for new armor.^I could use some spare metal.
Splendid! I have to keep my customers happy, even if they're Roman.
My son's shirt has another hole in it.^ If I don't get needles, I'll have to buy him a new one.
Thank you! I can't afford to buy my growing boy new clothes all the time.
Would you like to help us make fleece blankets?^First, you'll need to fleece my sheep over there.
Well done! I can tell you're the handy sort.^The other shepherd will help you weave these into warm blankets.
The fishermen need to warm up when they return at night.^We can use the looms to make your fleeces into blankets.
Your weaving is spectacular! It will keep someone very warm at night.
Stop right there, Yeshua! We have some questions for you.
What's this all about? Are they going to hurt Yeshua?
I'm making lemonade! Do you have any lemons?
The lemons your friends gave me are ripe and juicy.^Perfect for lemonade!
My parents will be cold this winter.^ Could you spare any cloaks to keep them warm?
My parents will be thrilled to have something warm to wear!
I'm repairing my house. Do you have any bricks?
Did you make these yourself? You're quite the craftsman!
Stop right there, Yeshua of Nazareth! We have questions for you.
What's this all about? Are they going to hurt Yeshua?
Our river town has not been doing well since the Romans built the highway.^If you help us fix the place up, the town leader will give you our treasure.
I'm exhausted from fishing all night. I still need to load them in my cart.
You have a special way of making everyone feel important. Thank you.
I haven't caught any fish lately. Can you spare any alms?
Your kindness has reminded me of God's love and provision. Bless you.
I don't have any servants now that business is slow. Can you help me take down the dried fish?
Thanks. I'll let the town leader know you helped out.
Some children played with my tools and left them everywhere!
I need to lock these tools away so the kids don't get hurt.
I need a bowl to present my fresh fruit for my business.
My business will thrive with my fruit displayed in such a beautiful red bowl!
I don't have any money, so I'm catching butterflies for fun.^Want to join me?
Butterflies remind me that God's beauty is everywhere, and He made it for us!
I can't walk through here with all these snakes!
Praise God you were here. The town can't afford a gardener anymore.
I handle the town leader's taxes, but the forms have scattered in the wind!
Thank you for returning those forms to the cart!^I won't forget this.
I've been out of work since no more trade comes through town.^Do you have any food?
This soup will last me for a few days. You've given me hope, stranger.
You've been a great help to my town, PNAME.^I need one last thing. My shepherds need new trumpets.
Your friends have just the trumpets I need. Thank you.^Here is the key to my treasure chest.
My father has lost his job and we have too much debt!^Please help!
Hooray! God really cares about me!^Thank you for helping us through this hard time.
My dessert at home needs something to add to the flavor.^Can you get me some lemons?
Lemons will spice up my boring dessert!
I need to find my way home in the dark tonight, but I don't have a lamp!
You're a lifesaver! Thanks for the lamp.
A band of musicians is coming to town, but I lost the shipment of harps they ordered!
Your friends are a real blessing.
We need to light these torches, or the guards will be angry!
Thanks for the help. Stay out of trouble, my friend.^Caesar's soldiers are uneasy with all these people around.
The Soldiers knocked over my pottery cart today.^Would you help me pick up the pieces?
Thank you. One day, God will send a Messiah to save us from these terrible Romans!
The doctor says mistletoe can make my mother stop coughing so much.
God will heal my mother. He's always provided for us so far.
I'm weaving a new shirt for my son, but I don't have any dye.
His favorite color is blue. How did you know?
Our flock's wool is getting too thick.^Let's shear the extra so we can make blankets and clothing.
Our sheep keep this town in business.^Without them, we wouldn't have clothes or food!
Grapes sound like a wonderful snack after my long journey.
These are delicious!
It's so late and I haven't made dinner yet!
There's so many people here for the census, I don't recognize most of them!^Thank you for the soup, stranger.
Joseph, I think I might have the baby anytime now...^Will we find a place to stay in time?
I'm very sorry Sir, but there is no vacancy here.^The entire town is full because of this census!
My master said you can stay here.^Sorry it's just a barn, but make yourselves at home.
I've always wanted a doll, but my parents can't afford it.
Wow! Thank you so much!
Hi I need a few sundials, I've really been losing track of time lately.
Thanks, these sundials are really going to come in handy!
I spent all my money just getting my family here.^Now I don't have any food for my children!
Bless you, stranger! I'm so glad I can feed my family.
We need a room for the night.
Please, my wife is pregnant. I need somewhere warm for her to sleep!
Well, I have a barn up the road where you can stay.^It's warm and it's dry, so it will be better than staying out in the cold.^I'm sorry, it's all I have to offer.
I'm sorry, Mary. This is all I could find for shelter tonight.^Let's get you inside so you can rest.

I'm going to visit my fiancé today. I don't know how I'm going to tell Joseph that I'm pregnant.^He'll never believe that God Himself gave me this baby!^I don't know how I'll survive if he divorces me.
I've been dragging sacks around all day! I could use something to eat.
Wow! This warm bread is amazing!
I'm helping to prepare the town for Mary's wedding soon.^Let's set up the flower pot stands!
They're beautiful. Great work, PNAME.
Mary's wedding is soon. I've got to make her a present.^The poinsettias are so gorgeous this time of year.
Just lovely! This is a perfect gift for Mary!
Mistletoe is just what I need to make my house a beautiful place to live!
Thank you! I'll put this mistletoe to good use.
My glassware shattered all over the ground!^I need to clean this up with all these children walking around.
I wouldn't want anyone to cut their feet on my glass. Thank you, friend.
I'm helping make the house pretty! Do you have any holly?
Holly smells good, but Mother says the berries are poisonous!
The house needs fresh flowers in the vases.
Thank you. Joseph has been acting strange.^Yesterday, he was very depressed...^but now he's running around singing psalms!
This pen is out of ink again! I'll never finish my report!
That was very helpful. I'll be sure to be lenient with Joseph's taxes this year.
I'm collecting berries for a pie. Do you have a basket or two I can borrow?
These baskets are just what I needed! Bless you.
I can't find my knife anywhere!^I've got to cut the meat before the fire dries it out.
Slicing my roast beef will be easy with this!
My sheepdog was hurt while protecting the flock.^I need some cloth to wrap his wound.
Your friends are very generous. My dog should be better soon.
Listen, Joseph. I know you must be angry, but I can explain...
I already know, my love.
You do? But I thought you were going to divorce me!

An Angel visited me in a dream last night. He told me everything.^That you bear God's child, that He will be the Messiah and save our people.^I can't divorce you knowing that this is God's plan. It won't be easy, but we'll get through this together.
I think those Pharisees in Magadan are up to no good...^Please help John set up an escape route, just in case.
It looks like the other disciples are having an argument...
Would you bring me some fleece blankets? My ones at home are a little ragged.
Our flock has very soft wool. These blankets are great!
I haven't had lunch. Let's have some soup!
Your egg soup is delicious!
I can't find all my tools! I have a job in town, and I'm already late!
Thanks for the help! I've got to get going.
I have an old battle wound that won't heal. Do you have ointment I can treat it with?
You're not so bad, Jew. Thanks for the ointment.
Judas, where's all the bread we had? Yeshua multiplied seven whole baskets of it!
Hello, I'd like to buy enough bread for fourteen people.
No problem! Let me pack that up for you.
Watch out for the "Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees".
What does he mean?
It's because we forgot the bread!
Why are you still talking about not having bread?^Do you still have eyes, but cannot see? Don't you remember?^When I fed the 5,000 how many baskets of leftovers did you pick up?
We must have left it in Magadan by accident. But hey, why is it my fault?
And how many baskets were there after I fed the 4,000?
I wasn't talking about bread, my friends.^The "yeast" is the corrupt teaching of the Pharisees.
Rabbi, I have a question. What was the "Sign of Jonah"?

The "Sign of Jonah"? Let's see...^Jonah was swallowed whole by a whale for three days.^Then it spit him out on the sea shore and he went to Ninevah.^Also, Jonah was the only prophet to bring God's love to our pagan enemies!^It's a mind-boggling story of God's mercy and forgiveness.
Yeshua should watch what He says about us Sadducees.
What Should I Say?
The righteous should never be afraid to speak out the truth!
Yeshua has the best intentions in mind. He just wants you to realize the truth.
Some of us have a lot of political sway. It would be easy to make Yeshua disappear...
Why are you so irresponsible? You're the treasurer!^Yeshua will be furious, I'm sure of it.
PNAME, there's a food merchant on the edge of town.^Why don't you go buy some for all of us?
I have a lot of old broken sandals.^If you repair them for me, I'll donate them to the poor.
That was quick! I'll be sure to give these sandals to someone in need.
I'm having a party tonight, but I don't have pitchers to serve drinks to my guests.
This yellow pitcher is stylish! I'll put it to good use at the party.
My husband is blind, and we have no more money left.^I don't know how we'll survive!
Thank you, PNAME. I needed a friend to encourage me.^Maybe Yeshua can heal my husband's blindness.^I need to tell him right away!
I'm going to skip rocks in the lake. Do you have any small stones?
Hooray! These stones are great!
I'm making lures for my fishing kit. I'll need red dye to attract the fish's attention.
A bright red color will attract all the fish for miles around!
That's horrible! Have faith. God will provide for you.^Let's get you some handkerchiefs to wipe your tears.
This doesn't look good, PNAME.^The Pharisees have a lot of political power here.^If things get out of hand, they might try to stone Yeshua.^Go prepare the boat, just in case we need to leave quickly.
Herod's taxes have been too high lately, and there are a lot of homeless people in Magadan.^Can you spare any food to donate?
This soup can feed a lot of people. May God shine His face upon you!
It's hard to believe Yeshua would reach out to the people in Decapolis.^Those cities are full of Romans!
What should I say?
The Romans are hungry for the truth. Yeshua said He came for the sick, not for healthy people.
I'm still trying to understand it myself. But He says His Kingdom is not of this world...
You're right. I was just as broken as any Roman pagan, maybe worse!^I was so full of hate and evil spirits until Yeshua rescued me from the darkness.
Everyone always told me the Messiah would come to destroy the Romans.^But Yeshua only shows love and compassion, no matter who you are.
How can you claim to be the Messiah? That's blasphemy!
I'm painting my house blue, but I can't find any blue dye for sale.
If you're truly the Messiah, give us a sign from Heaven.^That should be easy for the Anointed One.

When you look at the skies, you can predict the weather.^You can interpret the appearance of the sky, but you are blind to see the signs of the times.^Why does this wicked generation ask for a miraculous sign?^This is the truth: no sign will be given to you but the Sign of Jonah!
I can't work in the fields unless I get my work sandals repaired!
These sandals are just like new! I'll have no problem farming with such fine sandals.
Did you make this? It's just the right shade of blue!
My daughter will soon be married.^Would you help me make perfume as a wedding gift?
This perfume has a lovely scent of myrrh. What a splendid wedding gift!
I found a crack in the hull of my fishing boat.^Can I borrow some metal to patch up the hole?
Thank Elohim! My fishing business was almost ruined.
You have that handy crab tosser, right?^Can you get rid of all these unclean crabs?
If I touched one of those shellfish, I'd be unclean all day! God bless, friend.
I need to move a lot of water to my farm to feed my animals.^Do you have any jugs with handles?
These jugs are perfect for carrying water to my farm!
I need to pack my goods onto a ship so I can sell my wares in Capernaum.^But I'm out of cargo boxes!
These crates are very sturdy. Well done!
It's time to pay Herod's taxes!
It's good to see someone doing their duty.
Stop avoiding our questions, Yeshua! You can't ignore us forever.
Come see my son, PNAME! Mary needs our help making him comfortable.
It's hard to see in here! Let's light the torches.
It's a lot easier to work in the light!
We can't have these spiders scaring the animals!
Thank you so much, PNAME. Spiders are disgusting.
It's cold out tonight. I would love some hot soup while I'm on patrol...
That soup looks delicious!
This dirty barn is no place for an infant.^But if I had handkerchiefs, I could make sure He stays clean.
With these handkerchiefs, little Baby Yeshua will stay clean all night!
This is Yeshua, PNAME. Isn't He beautiful?^I need a place for Him to sleep tonight.^Please bring me some hay.
I can't believe I've just seen the Messiah!^Let's praise God together!^If only I had a harp...
With these harps, I'll spread the word.^Emmanuel has come! God is with us!
I've been patroling for Herod all day and night. Do you have anything to eat?
Your kindness warmed my heart, even though you're a Jew.
Go to sleep, my Son.
He'll be cold without blankets. Please find some for me, PNAME.
One day, this little Baby Yeshua will be the salvation for everyone.^He is God's gift to mankind.
I'd like to air out the barn. There's fragrant mistletoe outside we can use.
I'll hang this mistletoe around the barn to clean out the air.
There's a hole in the roof. Can you bring me clay to patch it up?
I'll patch up the hole with this clay.^I wouldn't want the baby to be rained on!
I haven't had a chance to eat yet. Herod is making us patrol all night.
This fried fish is so tender! Thanks.
Did you see that?! We've got to find the Messiah.^Can you help us finish our work so we can start the search?
It's a cold night. We'll need blankets so we can watch over the sheep.
Your weaving is sturdy. Splendid work, my friend.
Herod is preparing his army. I've got to get my armor repaired.^Do you have any spare metal?
I don't want to complain, but I think Herod is growing too old to rule.^He's always paranoid about assassins.
PNAME, come inside quickly! I have a son!
I looked away for just a moment...^ and now those foxes have trapped my poor sheep!
Thank Elohim you were there to save her!
Some of the flock haven't had anything to drink.^Please take some water to them.
Sheep don't sleep well if they are thirsty. Thanks for the help.
All the little lambs ran away!
You found them all? Thank you!
I need a snack before I go back to sleep.
Everyone is so excited. Did I miss something important when I was sleeping?
I'm going to give the sheep a bath in the morning.^I'll need ceramic bowls to hold the water.
These bowls are just the right size for bathing the flock tomorrow!
I can't find my shoes!
Thank you. These shoes are great!
King Herod is getting paranoid, and he's demanded I learn to use a bow.^Do you have any arrowheads? I need to make some arrows.
I don't see why Herod is so scared of going to war.^I best do as he says and learn archery soon!
Help us harvest our crops and we'll share a Bounty with you!
Thanks! Now bake Raisin Bread to sell to those Traders.
Let's bake Raisin Bread to sell to those traders.
做得好！這未發酵的麵包味道鮮美。
我們讓他們進去後，這些商人製造了一個大的混亂！ ^幫我擦地板，我就給你廚房的鑰匙。
感謝您的幫助，這個地方看起來乾淨多了！^現在可以使用廚房。不要燒傷自己！
幫助我裝載並給水驢子渴。我們必須在食物變質之前回到市場！
感謝您的幫助！^這裡是一個存儲的鑰匙－去付款吧！
I'm looking for Herbs. Maybe some are growing in the garden?
下面是廚房的鑰匙。
This shipment will make me a good profit at the market. ^ Can you scrounge up some Olives?
我就知道你能幫助我。 ^這是你的鑰匙！
我們的貨車在往這裡的道路上損壞了！^幫助我們修復，好讓我們可以再次移動。
謝謝！這些車看起來像新的一樣！
Clear these dead trees so that we can grow more Grapes!
感謝您的幫助！
你能幫我挑花給我朋友嗎？
謝謝！她有一個糟糕的一天，但這些能讓她振作起來！
PNAME, can you gather pebbles so the mason can fix the walls?
These are hard times. That was very generous of you.
Before I let you through to the rest of the garden, please tie bows on all my sheep.
Thank you. I have other flocks I need to attend to now.
I need to ask for a huge favor. I need to make soup for the party.^Can you help me harvest these vegetables?
Thanks PNAME. You're a life saver!
I was asked to help cook but I can't get started without a few knives.
Thanks! Those knives will help a lot.
The party guests will be arriving soon!^Help me clear out the trash and dead logs.
Thanks for the help. I think the master is waiting for you now.
Those horses made a mess of the path! Can you help me clean up?
Wow, that really helped!
PNAME, parts of our garden are overgrown! ^Can you clear the overgrown grass?
Thanks! The master is waiting for you.
Well done, PNAME. I have a reward for you.^I'll give you the key if you will put garlands on my horses for me.
As promised, here is your key.^Thank you for your assistance, PNAME.
I'm on water duty today. ^Do you have any watering cans?
Thanks. Now I can get back to my job.
Thanks! This is a splendid color.
The master wants a new robe for the party.^Could I trouble you for some blue dye?
I have travelled far from a distant land. I must speak to your King immediately.^Please gain an audience for me and my companions.
You really save me there. Thank you, friend.
The Wise Men are waiting for a meeting with the King.^Quick, bake matzo bread so we have something to serve them!
I'll serve this bread to the King's guests right away.
I can't finish the King's dinner until I move all the cabbages into the cart.
King Herod will love this cabbage stew. It will be my best creation yet!
Please help me get rid of the spiders. They are scaring the servants.
Bless you! The spiders were causing the servants to have accidents.
You there, servant.^I want to present the King a gift.^Bring me blue bowls for the King.
These bowls are splendid.
The furniture hasn't been cleaned today. Those tables and chairs would be a good start.
Nicely done, PNAME. With such a big palace, there's always something dirty to clean!
Please lead the way.
I'm redecorating Herod's kitchen. Do you have any Cooking Knives?
This will accent the theme of the room perfectly!
This pen is out of ink again? I need to finish this report immediately!
Thank you! Sorry, I hadn't realized I was blocking the doorway.
I've almost completed my analysis of Hosea.^Please bring me the scrolls I need!
Marvelous. God's word is fascinating!
King Herod requests your presence in the throne room.
Of course! We'll be there right away.
How do the spiders make these cobwebs so fast? I cleared them out yesterday!
You have studied the Scriptures your whole lives.^Tell me, where is the Messiah to be born?
Where are my scribes? I need the experts of the Scripture to answer my question!
I forgot to bring the King a gift! How can I have a meeting with him now?
Your friends saved me! Thank you.
I can't seem to find the watering cans... As the grounds manager, I need to start work soon.
It's almost dawn. I better start watering the garden.
Servant! Bring me something to eat.
I was famished. Thanks for the warm meal.
If one of the guards sees the cobwebs, there will be a lot of trouble for me.
If I can't finish dusting the statues, I could be fired!
Thanks for the help. No one wants to upset the King these days.^He's becoming paranoid, always afraid someone is trying to kill him.
The stone columns are grungy. Do your job and chisel off the grime!
I didn't know the columns could be that beautiful!
I missed some spots when I was cleaning the floors.^If Herod sees this, I'll be executed!
Where is the King of the Jews to be born?^We have followed His star since it rose in the night sky.^It has led us here, to your kingdom, Lord Herod the Great.
King of the Jews?^So there are even signs in the sky of the coming Messiah...^I must check with my scribes. Please give me a moment.
Thank you. You may go.
The prophet Micah wrote the Messiah will come from Bethlehem, and he will be King over all of Israel.
In Bethlehem, Lord King. The Messiah must be born in Bethlehem, in the province of Judea.
King of Israel? No, no. This cannot happen. It will not happen...
You will find the Child in the town of Bethlehem.^When you find Him, report to me, so that I can also come and worship Him.
Of course, my Lord. It would be our pleasure.
King Herod is being suspicious. We should be careful around that man...
The Star of the Messiah has led us here, to Bethlehem.^PNAME, will you show us the way to the house of Mary and Joseph?
I really need a snack after all this hard work!
Isn't it amazing? The Messiah was born in this very town!^Thanks for the peaches!
I'm collecting poinsettias as a gift for Baby Yeshua. Can you help?
Thanks for your help. You don't have many chances to give the Anointed One a gift!
I'm helping Mary while she cares for Baby Yeshua.^I need a few ceramic bowls to set the table for dinner.
These bowls are superb! Did you make them yourself?
I have a special recipe for tea that requires holly, but I can't find any.
My tea will be wonderful after I boil these holly leaves!
My pen is out of ink again. Can you bring me some more?
Safe travels, friend! Thanks for the ink.
I don't want Mary to slip on one of the puddles. Can you help dry them with rags?
I must have used too much water when I was cleaning the floor.
I lost my dearest set of earrings! What will I do?
You found them? Praise God!
Why don't we freshen up the house?^Let's set up flower pots on the flower stands!
You have a servant's heart, PNAME. It's good to have you around.
I don't think I can wait until dinner. Do you have anything to eat?
These pomegranates are wonderful. May God shine His face upon you!
I have trouble breathing most days. Could you pick me some mistletoe?
Mistletoe clears my lungs when my condition gets worse. Thank you.
I'm amazed. Almost every day now, God reveals another wonder about Yeshua.
We'll need something to eat as well. PNAME, please bring me raisin bread from the kitchen.
Joseph, we just settled here. Where will we go?
Where did they go? We need to find the son of Joseph before they escape!
delete this line
Who are you?
I'm repairing my house tomorrow. Do you have any clay I can use?
That was very generous of you! I hope Mary and Joseph have a safe journey.
I need to feed my family and I'm out of fish hooks.^Do your friends have any they can spare?
With these fish hooks, I'll make a big catch today!
Some friends are visiting tonight.^Could I have some roman glassware to decorate for the party?
This glass is beautiful. I'm sure it will impress my friends!
We three are astronomers from a distant land.^One night, we saw a sign in the heavens that the King of the Israel has been born.^We knew that we must come and worship Him!
Please accept our gifts, Young King. I have brought you gold.
I have brought you the finest myrrh.
And I have brought frankincense. Praise be to You and to your Father in Heaven!
Mary, we must prepare to leave. I had another dream.^Herod is searching for our son. He'll kill Him!^PNAME, will you bring us some clothes for the trip?
It's just for a little while. One day soon, Herod will die and all of this will be forgotten.
This way!
With all these people coming to hear Yeshua, someone will trip over my crates.^Please help me load them in my cart!
Thanks, friend. Welcome to Bethsaida.
My cane snapped on my way to see Yeshua.^Would you mind making me a spare?
You are a godsend, my friend. Blessings on your travels.
These crowds are probably going to stay late tonight.^Hey, you! Light the lamps so they can find their way home.
Good work. I don't want any trouble, you hear?
I have to cook my daughter something to eat, but I don't have a cooking pot.
God bless you! These pots will do just fine.
I'm too old to clean these grimy pillars. Will you help?
Yeshua's followers are always so kind. He must be an amazing man.
A rude guest broke my last red bowl last night!
Your craftsmanship is marvelous, PNAME.
My wife promised to bake a pie today. Will you help me collect peaches?
These peaches are the best! The pie will be great!
I've got to replace my oven soon. I need bricks to start building it.
You're very kind. Enjoy your stay in Bethsaida!
I'd like to have a shade tree in my yard one day.^Do you have any seeds?
Thanks for the seeds, friend!
It's my mother's birthday. I'd like to get her jewelry, but I can't afford it!
This means so much to me! Thank your friends for the jewelry!
I've traveled a long way to get here before Yeshua goes to another town!^Please lead me to Him! I want to see again!
This Yeshua heals foreigners and Jews alike.^I wonder why He would bother.^Unless they convert and follow Elohim, they'll just continue to follow their pagan gods.
What should I say?
I don't know how, but I think Yeshua has a plan to save the pagans, not just the Jews.
There are many good pagans. Perhaps following the right god is less important?
God certainly cares for everyone, non-Jews included. You make an interesting point.
The Scripture is very clear. Doing good things is not enough, PNAME.^What makes Jews different is our relationship with God, not our good deeds.
Let me take your hand and guide you out of town.^PNAME, please lead the way.
Do you see anything?
I see people, but they look like walking trees.
Go home, Beloved. Don't even go into town.
It's amazing! I can see!
Yeshua, please heal my eyes. I want to see again!
My master wants these dirt piles cleared out, can you lend me a hand?^If you do, I'll give you these door handles I found.
Thanks for the help, here are the handles I told you about.
Hello! I need some fried fish.
Thanks for the fried fish.
I could use your help, PNAME. We are travelling to the villages around Caesarea Philippi and need cargo for our donkeys.^Can you help us find some?
I haven't had anything to eat while visiting the temples today.^Have any snacks?
These almonds are wonderful.^What are you Jews doing here, anyway? All these temples are for Roman gods.
I've got to get all this grain up the hill to Caesarea Philippi before sundown!
Thanks for loading the cart.^Maybe I can find someone to lend me a horse to tow it up to the town.
I've come from Greece to see these wonderful temples.^I can't believe I forgot to pack a lunch!
These herb rolls are wondeful!^May the gods favor you, stranger.
The tourists here worship the gods even at night.^Please light the torches.
I heard these woods are haunted with spirits.^I'm glad we have good lighting around here.
What's so special about you Jews?^Does it really matter what god you follow if you are a good person?
What should I say?
We aren't like you pagans, who just pray to get what you want from your gods.
Elohim chose us so that He can live among us. We have a relationship with Him.
That's absurd. Everyone knows that the gods are just as selfish as humans.^We have to manipulate them to get what we want.
No one has a special relationship with a god! Serving only one god makes you weak.
A Jew like you should watch out around here. I serve Pan, god of Nature.^This is his domain, not Elohim's!
What should I say?
I stand in the Shadow of the Almighty. Your gods can't hurt me.
God is Lord of everything. He made everything, and He rules all, even your "gods".
Careful, Jew. Or you may summon your own destruction!
How does Caesar tolerate such treasonous claims?!^You should be executed for such blasphemy!
I'm so thirsty! Could you spare something to drink?
Bless you, stranger! I thought I was dying of thirst.
I need to replace my cracked glassware.^Do your friends have any I can have?
This roman glass is lovely.
I saw an eagle nearby. Can your friends help me find more?
I like to collect feathers. Thank you!
Who do people say the son of man is?
Some people say you're John the Baptist. Others say Elijah.
And some others say you are Jeremiah or one of the prophets of old raised from the dead.
But what about you? Who do you say I am?
You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.
Blessed are you, Peter son of Jonah, for you did not learn this by man's ways, but from my Father in Heaven!^On you I will build my Church, and the Gates of Hades will never overcome It!
My dear friends, the Son of Man must soon go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the Elders.^I will be killed, and on the third day, I will be raised to life.
Never, Lord!^This will never happen to you!^I won't let that happen!
Get behind me, Satan! You are not concerned with God's plan, but with human desires.

If anyone wants to be my follower, they must deny themself and take up their cross and follow me.^Whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me and the Good News will save it!^I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the Kingdom of God come with Power.
Thanks for your help gathering the cargo, PNAME.^We're about to leave for Mount Hermon soon.
Yeshua is hiking up to the top of Mount Hermon.^I wonder what He's planning to do?^PNAME, catch up to the disciples and find out what's going on!
How can there just be One God? Aren't there many gods to many people?
If I'm going to finish my patrol today, I'll need something to eat...
Wow! This honey will give me the energy I need to keep going!
I'm hiking up the mountain to pray.^John, James and Peter, please come with me.^The other nine will wait for us here.
I have a long journey ahead of me. Do you have any wine?
Your friends keep good wine around! Blessed travels, friend.
I'm collecting seeds for the birds. Can you help?
These seeds will be a tasty snack for the birds. Thanks!
I'm still miles from town. Can I bother you for some bread pudding?
This bread pudding is delicious. Bless you, stranger!^May the gods favor you.
What should I say?
There is only One True God. All the others are fakes.
To serve any other God is rebellion. We must only serve Elohim.
Why is he accusing me? I thought he was my friend...
You sound arrogant, claiming only your God can be the real one.
My son is possessed of an evil spirit!^Every day, it gives him seizures and makes him scream.^Please ask your friends to heal my boy. I've tried everything else.
I'm going to surprise my husband with a new perfume!^I'm not too sure about the ingredients. Can you help?
The perfume you made is lovely. My husband will love it.
I forgot my lunch! If I go back to get it, I'll miss out on seeing Yeshua!
Thank you. This might be my only chance to meet Yeshua.
I have some old sandals lying around that need fixing.^Do you have time to help me out?
My sandals are better than ever!
I need boxes to ship my supplies to my store in Caesarea Philippi.
These cargo boxes are just the right size! Bless you!
Will you help me catch the butterflies?
Aren't they beautiful? God's creation is full of wonders!
delete this
It's not our fault! Yeshua is the one who usually does this.
Quick, that man's son needs our help!
That little boy is possessed. Please help us cast it out.
You cast out demons from people a few weeks ago.^Can you cast one out of that little boy?
Don’t tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.

Yes, Elijah must come first, preparing the way for the Messiah. He comes to restore all things.^But Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, and they did to him everything they wished.^In this way, the Son of Man will also suffer at their hands.
My scale is off balance. If I had small stones, I could correct the weight difference.
With my scale fixed, I'll make my money calculations twice as fast!
Would you help me? I have a recipe that requires a lot of olives.
This salad will be full of rich flavor with these olives in it!
If you bring me yellow bowls, I'll fill them with water so the disciples have something to drink.
You crafted splendid yellow bowls, PNAME. I'll pass out water for the disciples to drink.
Can you heal my son?
Of course we can! We've done this many times.
Why isn't it working? Didn't Yeshua give us authority over evil spirits?
Please cast the demon out of my son!
Don't worry, sir. We have God's anointing.
How can this be?
None of the others can heal my boy. Can you?
We've even raised the dead. A demon is nothing!
This demon must be very strong! I can't believe it won't leave!
Nothing you are doing is working!
What are my disciples arguing with you about?
Lord, have mercy on my son.^A spirit siezes him and he suddenly shakes and screams!^One day it will kill him! I begged your disciples to help, but they could do nothing.
How long must I put up with this unbelieving generation?^Is this your son?
How long has he been like this?
From childhood. It will throw him in the river or in a fire, trying to kill him.^If you can do anything, please take pity on me and do something.
Evil spirit, leave him and never return!
I believe, Lord. Help my unbelief!
If I can? Everything is possible for someone who believes.
He’s dead!
Is he talking about Ezekiel's prophecy?
What does "rising from the dead" mean?
So John the Baptist was Elijah? I never noticed...
He's talking about John the Baptist!
Rabbi, why do the Scribes say that Elijah must come before the Messiah?
How can you be disciples of Yeshua if you can't even do this?
It's impossible! He was dead! Just who is this Yeshua person?
Hello, PNAME. Ruth left for Mount Hermon a few moments ago.^You should join her and follow in Yeshua's footsteps.
It will be dark soon. Could you be troubled to light the lamps before you go inside?
Thanks for the favor. Rabbi Yeshua is waiting for you inside.
The pillows are so dusty. We better fluff them before the master notices.
That's much better!
If you bake some matzo bread in the ovens, I'll pack it away for you to take on your trip.
Fresh matzo bread is the best. I'll pack this for you.
Welcome to my home, PNAME!^Yeshua will surely need scripture scrolls to study on His travels.^Please fill the baskets with scrolls from my collection.
Yeshua told me about you. I can see why He likes you so much.^You have a heart full of kindness.
The mopping isn't done yet. I'm very busy. Can you lend a hand?
You're a handy person to have around!
It's important to bring along an extra set of robes.^Could you pack them in the baskets in the middle of the room?
Thanks for your help, PNAME.
We'll need something to drink on the way to Galilee. Could you please fill the wine skins on the wall with fresh wine?
Nice work, PNAME. We've got enough wine for a whole week!
Rabbi, what happened back there? Why couldn't we drive out that demon?
That kind of spirit only comes out by prayer and fasting. And that's not the only problem.^I have more to teach you. Let's go out into the yard.
Do you have any soup? I'm famished.
Thanks, friend! I've got to get back to work now.
Hi! Can I have some peaches? I'm hungry.
Thank you! I love peaches.
PNAME, what I want to explain next requires an example.^Will you retrieve some mustard seeds from the mustard plants nearby?
You said that some demons only leave through prayer and fasting.^But what else do we lack, Lord?

The demon did not leave because you have so little faith, my friends.^Do you see how small this mustard seed is? Even seeds this small grow to be huge plants!^This is the truth: if you have the faith as small as a mustard seed...^you can tell a mountain, "move away" and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.
I'm donating fruit to Yeshua's cause.^Do you have any fruit boxes?
I'm sure this will be very helpful as Yeshua travels around Galilee.
I'm having trouble staying on schedule these days.^Do you know anyone with spare sundials?
Your friends were a big help! Thank you.
I'm picking berries for a pie, but I can't find my berry baskets!
Bless you, friend! You were very generous to lend me these berry baskets.
You never know when someone will get a scrape or cut on the road.^We should be prepared and pack some ointment.
I'll pack this ointment for the disciples. Just in case they need it.
The rabbi has been very kind to let us stay the night here.^Now that we're leaving, we should clean up after ourselves.^Would you please roll up the bed mats?
We should always remember to show respect for someone's hospitality.
Please, I just need more time. I'll pay you back as soon as I get the money!
I'm going to find Yeshua and ask Him about the temple tax. I'll meet you at the house.
Could you give me a hand loading my fish into my carts?
I need to get these carts all the way up the hill to the market.^It's going to be a long day...
I'm shipping goods to the other side of the lake.^Sawdust will keep everything nice and secure in my crates.^Do you have any sawdust?
Wonderful! I knew you were the helpful sort.
Andrew brought in a catch of fish today and spilled water all over.^Let's mop up the puddles so no one slips.
Thank you for cleaning up the water, PNAME. ^Speaking of water, I hope we don't travel by boat anytime soon!
Andrew squeezed out the oil from the fish into jars.^Can you collect it for me so I can sell it in the market?
This fish oil will sell for a good price.^This will provide for us while Yeshua is here in Capernaum.
I'm helping renovate this house while we stay here.^Please knock down the weak walls to make more room.
The house is slowly coming together.
I'm so hungry... Do you have something you can spare?
Did you bake this for me? Wow! I feel so... loved.^Thank you, PNAME.
I'm playing the harp in the town festival, but I'm out of practice.^Do you have any harps I can borrow?
With these harps, I'll practice as hard as I can to impress everyone in town!
Do you have something to play with?
Now I have lots of dollies!
My friend at home is injured. Can I borrow some ointment for his wounds?
He'll appreciate your kindness. Thank you.
Doesn't your Teacher pay the temple tax?
What do you think, Peter?^Does a King collect taxes from his children?
I don't know what Yeshua has planned, but I'm willing to try anything...
Amazing! It's just as Yeshua said. There's a coin in its mouth!
He's not above the law!
Yes, my Teacher pays the tax. At least, I think He does.
PNAME, I'm going to need my fishing pole. I think I left it outside.^Can you find it for me?
I can't find the key. Where did I leave it?^I must have dropped it in the bushes...
How did He know about what the tax collectors said?
The King would collect taxes from others. Not his children.

Then the children are exempt.^But so we don't offend anyone, go to the lake and cast out your fishing line.^The first fish you catch will have a four-drachma coin in its mouth.^Take that and pay them the temple tax for both of us.
There's an old friend of mine I'm meeting today.^Could you help me find my old friend, the poor servant?
My caravan is leaving soon. Would you load my donkeys with the cargo from my market stalls?
I'm sure I'll make a huge profit this time! At least, if my caravan isn't attacked by robbers...
Do you have a cane an old man like me can use while I shop in the market?
You're a fine example of someone who honors their elders. Thank you.
The sun will set soon. I'd appreciate it if you lit the torch stands.
Nice work. I've got to keep my eyes open for trouble.
I'm out of perfume! Do you have any I can sell?
This perfume will sell out soon. I need to order some more.
I'm hungry! Do you have any food?
Wow! Peaches! I love peaches!
I need to grab lunch while I'm out shopping today.
This lunch you packed is delicious!
I'm learning to tell time. Do you have any sundials?
Great! Thanks for helping me.
I'm baking a wonderful dessert, but I don't have any honey!
Oh, thank you PNAME! My dessert will be perfect with this honey.
The stone columns in our town have grown moss all over.^Let's chisel it off so the town can shine again!
It gives our town pride to have a beautiful marketplace!
Something we must see will happen soon, but first...^ That woman seems to need some help.
Do you have any jugs with handles? I need to carry a lot of water to my farm.
Your friends are a godsend. Bless you, PNAME!
Please help me! I don't have enough time to fill my grain carts all by myself!
You have a compassionate spirit, PNAME. Thank you.
You did the right thing, PNAME.^I fear the King's servant may not be so wise...
I've found my friend! Thank you for your assistance, PNAME.
You owe me 100 denarii! Pay back what you owe me!
Please be patient with me! I'll pay you back soon!
What's he doing?! The King needs to hear about this...
Guards! Take him away.^Let him sit in prison until he repays what he owes me.
Hello, PNAME. Welcome to the King's palace.^I believe there is an important lesson to learn here today...^The King requests your presence in his throne room.
I'm too famished to wait for lunch!
Your herb rolls are fantastic! Thanks!
I haven't finished mopping the floor yet.^The King is a gracious person, but I don't want to test his patience.
Your help is greatly appreciated!
The King's most trusted servants will be hungry soon.^Would you help finish the stew I started in the kitchen?
Wonderful! With your help, I have a head start on lunch.
The most trusted servants of the King need matzo bread with their stew.^Please bake some in the ovens for me.
Fresh warm matzo is perfect with fish stew!
The King is having guests for a gala tonight. We need to dust those pillows!
The throne room must be spotless for the party.
Those crates need to be shipped to a faraway place tomorrow.^Please load them in the carts.
Nice work. No wonder the King trusts you so much!
I have much too much to do today. Would you mind cleaning the sculptures?
Thank you for the assistance.
The lamps need to be lit for the party.
The King's security requires me to see well. Thanks for lighting the lamps.
My shabbat reading is in a couple days. I'll need to practice so I don't make any mistakes.
The chanting for the shabbat reading can be difficult. Thanks for finding my scrolls!
I haven't eaten in days. Could the King spare something to eat?
Those apples were splendid! Elohim bless you and your family, friend!
PNAME, today I will settle my accounts with my most trusted servants.^Please summon them here to the throne room.
I hope my servants will follow my example. A leader must be merciful to his followers.
I dropped the bowl I was washing for lunch.^Do you have another I can borrow?
Wow! These red bowls look brand new!
I'm gathering berries for the King's dessert tonight. I could use some baskets to get the job done.
Thank your friends for the berry baskets!
The King's dinner needs fresh meat. Do you have any arrowheads I can use to go hunting?
These arrowheads are very sharp! I'll have an easy time hunting today.
The King requests your presence in the throne room.
The King requests your presence in the throne room.
The King requests your presence in the throne room.
Today I am settling my accounts. Where is the money I loaned you?
You owe me some money, but I know you cannot pay me back.^I will forgive your debt.
You owe me 60 million denarii, my servant.^Where is the money?
I have it here, my King. Thank you for your generosity.
Thank you, my King! I won't forget this!
I don't have it yet. Please give me more time.
Since you cannot repay me, I will sell you into slavery.^You, your wife and family and all your possessions will be sold to repay the debt.
No! Be patient with me, my King!^If you give me more time, I'll repay you everything!
Very well. I release you, my servant. You no longer owe me anything.

The King's other servants are coming to tell Him about the unforgiving servant's deeds.^He's still trying to pay back the King, instead of receiving His forgiveness.^He's throwing the King's mercy right back in His face.
Would you mind cleaning up the puddles?^I forgot to wipe them up after I mopped.
The floor is shining! Great job!
I want to make this room beautiful for the King.^Let's fill the vases with flowers!
The flowers are lovely.
I've got to play my new song for the King soon! Where is my music?!
You found my music sheets? Praise God!
I collect only the finest cheeses. I'd like to sample the cheeses of this fine country.
This cheese is some of the best I've tasted!
The King will have His dinner soon. Will you help set the tables?
I've prepared a feast for the King. I'm sure He'll love it!
I can't find my earrings anywhere! I must have dropped them somewhere around here.
You found my earrings! Thank you.
These spiders keep coming back no matter how many times I get rid of them.^Would you mind helping me?
I hope those spiders are gone for good!
I have a long trip ahead of me.^Could you grab my cargo from the barrels in the storage room?
Bless you, friend! That was very kind.
I have so much to do! Please dust the statues so I can finish early.
Why, thank you! I'll tell the King about how helpful you are.
My King, the servant you forgave has thrown our friend in prison for a mere 100 denarii.
He's very poor and he can't afford to pay back the debt.^How can he pay back the debt when he is in prison?
What?! That wicked servant has rejected my forgiveness.^This is an outrage! Bring him to me at once!
I can't go out in the rain!^Do you have any cloaks? I'm in a hurry.
Thank you for the cloaks! It will be a relief to be dry on the way home.
I have an audience with your King soon.^Can I bother you for something to drink?
Wonderful. My compliments to the King's chef.
My allergies are acting up. Do you have any handkerchiefs?
I'll put these handkerchiefs to good use. Thank you.
The unforgiving servant is about to be sentenced by the King.^Let's go see what God will teach us through this experience.
I can't believe it! I forgot to give the prisoners drinking water!
Thanks for passing out water. I'm still getting used to dungeon duty.
I can't see anything in here! Someone light the lamps!
Wow, that really helped. Thanks for lighting the lamps.
I haven't eaten for hours. I can't wait until my shift is over...
Hey, thanks! These herb rolls are wonderful!
This dungeon is filthy. Let's clean the place up, starting with all these cobwebs.
Thanks for clearing the cobwebs, I hate them!
We should let some light in here.^Please chisel the cracks in the wall to make windows.
The makeshift windows are a nice touch!
The spiders in here are scarier than the prisoners! I really wish someone would get rid of them...
I'll take the meanest guy in here over one of those spiders any day! Thanks!
You evil servant! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me!
My King, I was simply trying to pay you back what I owe.
Should you not have shown mercy to your fellow servant, just as I showed it to you?^Torturer, take him away until he repays all that he owes me!
I've been charged with sewing new uniforms for the prisoners, but I need more cloth.
Nice! The prisoners will certainly be much more comfortable wearing this material.
We're making the prisoners new uniforms.^Do you have any red dye I can use?
No one will escape if they're wearing one of those red uniforms!
I came to visit my friend in prison.^I wish I had some of David's Psalms to read and comfort him.
My friend will certainly be blessed by these scriptures!^I pray they persuade him to turn his life around.
This is terrible, PNAME! We've got no bread or water!^All we have is this nasty Manna.^Please convince Moses to do something about it!
Maybe God will still hear our cries.^Would you bring me some prayer shawls?
With these prayer shawls, I will ask God to give us bread.
When will my People cease their complaining?^God has already graced us with Manna and Quail every morning and evening.
Everyone is tossing trash on the ground! We should clean it up.
We can recycle most of our trash for new things.^It's a waste to throw it all away.
Help! These snakes are everywhere!
You saved me! El Shaddai bless you.
Before you meet with Moses, would you mind helping out people around the camp?
You found some quality resin! Thanks, friend.
I need to keep warm tonight. Could you gather sawdust for me so I can start a fire?
It will be nice to have a fire to sleep by.^ If only we had something other than Manna to eat!
Moses, the people are speaking against God and saying they're sick of Manna.^What should we do?
Thanks, PNAME. It's hard to find people that are helpful around here.^Everyone is always too busy grumbling at Moses.
I need a few planks to fix my broken cart.
Did you cut these planks yourself? They're just what I needed!
Some of our plunder from Egypt crashed on the ground.^Can you help me load the shards into the carts?
Thanks, PNAME. I just wish I had something to thank God for.^He's abandoned us in this wilderness!
I can't repair my broken pottery without resin to seal the cracks!
I'm sick of all this Manna!
We don't have any water! We'll die of thirst out here!
God brought us out of Egypt so we could die out here.^We were better off as slaves!
We are thankful to have found this green valley in the wilderness.^We must use this opportunity to feed our cows.^Can you help?
We will lead our cows through the desert soon, so it's good they have lots of grass right now.
It's getting close to winter. Please shear the sheep so we can make warm blankets for ourselves.
This wool is very soft. Well done, PNAME!
Help! There are snakes in the camp!
One of them bit me! I'm going to die!
One of them bit me! I'm going to die!
PNAME, please take this man to Moses.^He always knows what to do.
Thank you for taking care of those snakes. Moses is up ahead.
The next time those bandits come around, they'll be in for a surprise!
I need flowers to help brew a snake bite remedy.
I don't think my remedy is working...
This brick is pefect. Thank you, PNAME!
I will ask the LORD to free us from this judgment.^You'll be well soon, my friend.
My tent cover keeps blowing away in the wind!^Do you have a brick I can use to weigh it down?
This dirt will soak up the snake venom... I think.
This is no place to treat the wounded!^Help me clean up this area.
That's much better. We need to keep our camp clean so people don't get infected.
If I had some grass, I might be able to create a medicine for our snake bites!
He's up ahead. But I need you to bring me mud to help tend all the wounded first!
No one gets past this point until we get rid of the snakes!
You're a life saver!^Or maybe not, I don't feel so good...
I'm looking for Moses. Do you know where he is?
Why are you standing in the way?^Can't you see I've been bitten?
Bandits have been raiding the camp lately! ^Can you bring me metal to arm our soldiers?
El Shaddai has answered my prayer!^I will build a bronze snake and raise it on a pole.^PNAME, please collect bars of bronze from around the camp so I can get started.
Thank you, PNAME. I need to get started right away.
With this bronze snake, Elohim will provide salvation for our people.
I'm crafting a medicine for the snakebites.^If you fill my bags with ingredients, I'll give you a torch.
Thanks! Hopefully this medicine will do the trick.^Here's that torch you needed.
The horses have been working very hard lately.^Let's give them flowers as a reward!
The horses are beautiful!
I can't take anymore of this boring Manna! Bake me some bread!
You're a lifesaver! I wish God would let us go back to Egypt.
Do you have any bricks? My cart keeps rolling down the hill.
Thank you for the bricks!
My camels need to eat while they still have a chance!
You never know when you'll run out of hay in the wilderness.
I don't have anything to play with...
I love dollies! Mommy says to always say thank you!
We have a problem... Some of us haven't bathed lately.^Could I bother you for myrrh resin to freshen up the smell?
Elohim bless you, PNAME!
PNAME, anyone who sees the bronze snake will be healed.^Let's get going.
We need stretchers to treat the wounded.^Can you bring me a few planks?
I'll fashion these planks into a stretcher and carry the wounded to see the snake.
We need to check the census numbers to see how many were attacked.^Can you bring the census papers to me?
These papers will let us know which families have been attacked.
We need tools to repair the camp after the panic that the snakes caused.
Perfect. I'll get started picking up the camp.
Maybe we can scare the snakes away with some trumpets!
I don't think the trumpets are helping. It was worth a try...
My tools got scattered all over the place in the confusion.^Can you help me find them?
I thought my business was finished! Thanks!
I want to make a tapestry to honor God's mercy. Do you have any blue dye?
This tapestry will be magnificent!
All the snakes attracted foxes to the camp! Can you help scare them off?
It's much safer without the foxes prowling around.
The tabernacle will be adorned with flowers today.^Please set up the flower stands for me.
Thanks, friend. All the snakes have made my job difficult.
God is healing us through the bronze snake!^I want to plant a garden to show my repentance.
The flowers we planted will be an offering to the Lord for His salvation.
THIS LINE IS UNNECESSARY. Ima firin mah lazer!!1!!
Do you have any wine to help treat the wounded?
This will be a big help. Thanks!
Moses can help me? Thank Elohim!
I've got to see that bronze snake before I die!
We need to hurry before too many die from snakebites.^Please gather the dying here at the center of the camp.
This will never work, but I don't have any better ideas...
Thank you, El Shaddai.^You have saved your People, even though we spoke against you.^Your mercy endures forever!
Please get rid of that crazy dog! I need to talk to Moses!
I've been healed! Praise the Lord Almighty!
Hallelujah! God has saved me from death!
I'm healed! I should have trusted God, but instead I was too busy complaining.^Forgive me, Lord!
Thanks for catching up with me, PNAME.
Yeshua is waiting for us in the house. We better get going.
Say what you want, Yeshua. But we know the truth.^You're just afraid they'll reject you.
If you were really the Messiah, you wouldn't be afraid to be seen in public!
So why don't you go to the Feast of Tabernacles, Yeshua?^You can't stay hidden in Galilee forever, not if you want to be a public figure.

The correct time hasn't come yet.^You think that any time would be correct, but the World does not hate you.^It hates me because I testify that what the World does is evil.^You go to the Feast. I'm not going yet.
A gust of wind came and blew away our records.^Would you mind filling the cart with our scattered tax forms?
Thanks for the help, PNAME. I wish Peter and the others would stop arguing.
I need a mortar and pestle to grind ingredients for medicine.^My friend is at home sick.
With this mortar and pestle, my friend won't be sick much longer.
My daughter and I are going to make clay dolls.^Do you have any spare clay?
She'll love playing with this clay you gave me!
Please help me finish washing the disciples' clothes.
Those clothes were filthy! Thanks for the help.
Surely I'll be the greatest in the Kingdom of God!
Why you? I think I've done quite a lot for Yeshua as well.
So what? I'm definitely closer to Yeshua than all of you.
Yeshua's waiting for us in the house, we should get going.
Jesus starting dialogue, calls child over.

Unless you change your ways and become like little children, you will never enter my kingdom.^Whoever humbles themselves like this child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.^And whoever welcomes a child like this in my Name welcomes me.^But be warned: For anyone who causes one of these to sin,^it would be better for them to drown in the sea with a millstone tied to their neck!^If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off!^It's better to enter Life with one hand than enter Hell with both.^Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again?^Have Salt in yourselves, and be at peace with each other.
dialogue mad
What were you arguing about?
If anyone wants to be first, he must be the very last, and the servant of all.^Little one, come stand with me.
Teacher, who is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?
Do you know anyone with handle jugs? I have a lot of sand I need to carry home.
These handle jugs are just perfect! Thank your friends for me.
I'm going on a picnic with my wife, but I forgot the lunches!
Thank you, friend! We'll enjoy these lunches you made.
My son wants a new hat, so I'm making one with eagle feathers in it.^Have you found any?
These feathers are spectacular!
PNAME, I lost the key to the front door. Would you find it for me?
We should stop for the night in this Samaritan town.^PNAME, I've sent James and John ahead of us.^Will you please help them prepare for our stay tonight?
My children were playing around and broke my only blue lamps.
You made such fine blue lamps!
I feel so clumsy. Would you help me pick up my smashed pottery?
It's so strange for a Jew to be helping a Samaritan like me...
Please... do you have any food?
You're a godsend! I haven't eaten in days.
I forgot my money at home, but I'm so thirsty...
Bless you, stranger! I can't believe a Jew would give me something to drink.
I think I've overworked myself. I would love a snack.
The apples were delicious! Well, back to work.
Yeshua's going to the Feast? There's no way he can stay in my inn!
You Jews think you know everything, worshipping in Jerusalem!^Don't ever come back here!
There's no warm welcome here for a Jew like Yeshua!^Get out of here!
There are three inns in this town.^We should be able to find one with room for all of us.
These Samaritans are so ungrateful! Can't they see the Messiah is in their presence?
Let's go. We'll be sleeping outdoors again.
They rejected us, Yeshua. They won't let us enter the city.
This is unforgivable!^Please, Yeshua, let us call down lightning from heaven to destroy them!
I'm out of work. Have anything to spare?
You're very kind! Too bad you're a Jew.
I have some fish on the fire at home. A lemon seasoning would be wonderful.
What fresh lemons you found!
My house is far away from the town well.^Do you know anyone with a spare watering can?
With all these watering cans, I'll be able to water all my plants in one trip!
No! My friends, I did not come into the World to destroy it. I came to save it.^Come, let us go to another town.
John and the other disciples are going the Feast of Tabernacles.^They're waiting for you in Galilee!
We're here to gather supplies and rest before continuing our trip to Jerusalem.^I think Matthew wanted to speak to you.^He went up ahead with Yeshua.
It's my wife's birthday. Would you help me make her perfume?
This scent is lovely. I can't wait to see how excited she is!
Please give my tired donkeys some water to drink.
My donkeys seemed ready to fall over a few minutes ago.^Thanks for the help!
We should have something that's easy to eat while we travel.^How about peaches?
Wow! These peaches are so juicy!
I'll be making us new travel sacks. Could you find me some leather please?
This is good, sturdy leather. Nice work, PNAME.
I haven't eaten since we left Samaria...
That soup is splendid! There's even enough to share!
Yeshua often has money troubles. You know...^I have a lot of friends. If you want a shortcut to success, I might be able to help...
What should I say?
God's plan doesn't include shortcuts.
Yeshua doesn't need money. God provides all that we need.
Well shucks
Can you bake us anything for the road ahead?
This bread pudding is delicious, PNAME.
Our donkeys will need food while we're on the road.
Thanks for collecting this hay. Without our donkeys, we'd have to carry everything ourselves!
If you bring me a few honey pots, I'll give the disciples a sweet treat.
I hope everyone likes my dessert!
Rabbi, I will follow you wherever you go.
Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.
Follow me.
Let the dead bury their own dead, but instead you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.
Lord, first let me go and bury my father.
I will follow you, Lord. But first let me go back and say goodbye to my family.
No one who puts a hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the Kingdom of God.
A stampede rushed by and broke all of my glassware!^Please help me clean up the pieces!
You're very kind, stranger.
There's a salad recipe I want to try, but I don't have any olives!
With all these olives, my salad will be marvelous!
I was hoping to catch my dinner in the river tonight, but I can't find my fish hooks.
Your friends are very generous. Thank you!
My friend is at home sick. Maybe flower decorations would cheer her up.
This vase is beautiful! I'll fill it with flowers and give it to my friend.
Following Yeshua is not always easy.^I have a feeling our following Yeshua will only become more difficult...

Welcome to the Temple, PNAME.^Your friend Thomas is waiting for you in the Inner Court but the gate is locked for The Feast celebration.^If you help tidy the area and talk to the Priests I'm sure they will lend you their door keys.
The priests don't have enough plates to eat with tonight.^We should donate some to the Temple!
This plate set will be well used, I'm sure.
The paint on our barrels has worn out.
Wonderful paint job! You must be a very handy person.
We can't have people slipping on those puddles!^You! Clean them up.
Thanks. The high priest would be angry if we had anybody complained.
Could you do me a favor?^I need to inspect all of my sheep for blemishes before I sacrifice them.
I always want to offer my best sacrifice to the Lord.^He brought us out of Egypt and parted the Red Sea!
Where is my gold?! It's time for the offering!
I've collected a lot of profit for the temple this year!^The high priest will be pleased.
I must perform a reading later today for the Feast.^Please retrieve the scrolls from the Temple archives.
I have a lot to practice, excuse me.
There's so much to do! You!^Do you have time to bake a little matzo bread in the ovens over there?
The priests will enjoy this bread for thier meal tonight.
My cows won't be sacrificed for another few days. Can you feed them some grass?
We should always care for God's creation, even if they will be sacrificed.
The lamps must be lit for tonight's ceremonies.
That Yeshua deceives the people. He's a fake.
Please, do you have any alms to spare?
Thank you! The Lord make His face shine upon you!
All the grain sacks need to be moved to the carts for the grain offering later.
The grain offering is soon. I better move these carts to the Inner Court.
Do you have any scissors? I'm cutting my hair as a dedication to God.
I want to show God my commitment to him by shaving my head.
The Temple needs fresh oil, but I don't have any jugs to carry it all in!
Your friends were very generous! Blessings on your Shabbat.
The priests need new prayer shawls, and I'm looking for donations.
The priesthood will appreciate your friends' generosity.
It's good to see you, PNAME!^I have fruit for my sacrifice this year. But I don't have a box to carry it!
Thank you for the fruit box. I hope you have a wonderful time during the Feast.
Those Pharisees are up to something...^PNAME, we've got to follow them!
Do you need a key for the gate? I have one right here.
I didn't realize someone locked the gate. Here's the key.
That man, Yeshua is here today. He is a good man.^Thanks for all the help around the temple. Here's the key to the gate.
How does this man know so much without studying Scripture?
My teaching comes from the One who sent me.^Has not Moses given you the Law? But no one keeps the Law.^Why are you trying to kill me?
He's possessed by a demon! He just spouts crazy things.
Who is trying to kill you?

I healed one man during Shabbat and you are all surprised.^But you yourselves do work on Shabbat.^If a child can be circumcised on Shabbat, why are you angry that I healed a man?^Make a correct judgment, instead of judging by appearances!
Is this the man the Pharisees are trying to kill?
He's out speaking publicly, but they aren't doing anything.
Maybe they decided He's the Messiah?
But we know where Yeshua is from. He's from Galilee!^When the Messiah comes, no one will know where he is from!
Yes, you know where I come from. But the One who sent me is with me.^You don't know Him, but I know Him.
We should seize him for saying such things!
Maybe we should stone him!
No! He may be the Messiah after all. We shouldn't judge so quickly!
The rest of the council needs to know Yeshua is here.^Let's hurry and speak to Gamaliel.
Those Pharisees are up to something...^PNAME, we've got to follow them!
The Pharisees are plotting against Yeshua!^John needs your help in Jerusalem!
Those Pharisees are up to something!^Let's sneak in and find out what they're planning.^I'll meet you inside, PNAME.
We're late! And Rabbi Gamaliel and Saul of Tarsus are here!^They're deciding what to do about Yeshua.^Even the High Priest is here!
Saul of Tarsus? I hope we don't leave a bad impression...
I dropped nails all over the ground. Would you help pick them up?
All those nails could hurt someone's feet! Thanks for the hand.
I'm baking a pie for the High Priest's visit today.^Do you have any apples?
These apples are gorgeous!
Do have any grapes? I'm so hungry...
I feel very refreshed! Blessings, friend.
I can't believe how fast these weeds grow back!
You're very talented with that axe!
The stone columns are our street have seen better days.^I wish we could clean them to show off during the Feast.
Wow! You made them shine!
No one is allowed inside while the High Priest meets with the Pharisees.
I'm still on duty, but the smell of that soup is intoxicating...
The rabbis will be talking in the dark soon if we don't light the lamps.
Much better. Thank you, stranger.
I can't afford a sacrifice this year, but I'm so grateful to God!^I only wish I had something to offer to the Temple...
You're giving this bread to me?^God has provided me with an offering!^May His face shine upon you, friend!
My master is very strict about cleaning his robes.^I need to gather them all before the guests see them lying around!
My thanks. I'll start washing these immediately.
Are you a friend of the High Priest?^The Pharisees dragged in a lot of mud and left dirty puddles everywhere!
Those rabbis are extremely rude! Not like you at all.
My master is almost ready for his nightly scripture reading.^Please retrieve his scrolls from the other room.
My master will be pleased that the scrolls were handled so carefully.
With all these guests, it's embarassing how dusty our house is!
The sculptures are shining! You must have a natural talent.
I can't hear anything they're saying from here.^If I can use a disguise to get past the guard, we can find out what they're plotting.
Great work, PNAME! Who knew a Pharisees would have a soldier's armor in his house?
Wrong way, friend. There's nothing for you to see back there.
You're early. Well, I'm not one to complain.
My dog hurt his leg chasing birds in the street.
With his leg set in these splints, he'll be running around again in a few weeks.
The rabbis must have something to drink while they visit.^Do you have any lemons?
My lemonade is the best in town.^I hope they enjoy the treat!
My master would like to replace his collection of roman glass.
All this glassware you found is exquisite!
I'm baking a snack for the Pharisees, but I've never made cookies.^Can you teach me?
Our cookies are fantastic!
He must be stopped. Let's have him arrested!
