Why thank you very much my friend!
Can't let you go to the celebration until the work here is done.
Wow, that looks great! I really like the design.
I'm sorry PNAME, my stall is a mess! I can't let anyone pass until we clean this up!
Oh thank goodness we got that cleaned up.^Sorry to put the pressure on you, but I really needed the help cleaning all this up.
PNAME! Just in time. Help me cook these stews and the boss back there will give your reward!^Thanks for your help so far but we just need you to help a little bit more.
Wow thanks. Couldn't have done it without your help.
Hi PNAME. I've got the key you need for this here treasure!^I don't need treasure but what I need are JARS.^If you could make me 5 JARS, you got yourself a deal.
Pleasure doing business with you.
Bring me something nice, and I'll return the Village's treasure!
I don't know why those Robbers had to smash our jars...
Thanks! It looks like the farmers need some help as well.
The Robbers made a mess of our market! ^ Help us clean up.
Great job! Reinforcements should be here soon.
The Robbers went into the woods behind me. Good luck getting our treasure back!
Thank you, PNAME. I feel much safer now.
Smells good! Our captain is across the river. ^He might be willing to give back what he stole from the village if you can help him.
Great job! Now I can get back to work.
Wow, this is much more valuable! I'll return everything I took.
Bandits raided the Market! Please help! If you get our treasure back, we'll let you have some of it.
The robbers beat me up when I tried to defend my stall...
Thank you! I need to go rest now.
Those Robbers came through and smashed everything! ^ Can you fix our market stalls?
We need to signal the soldiers about these robbers. Quick, light the signal fires!
We have to harvest our crops before the Robbers come back.
There's bound to be more bandits down this road.^Could you light the torches so I can see where I'm going?
Those Villagers didn't put up much of a fight. ^ Cook me something to eat, or I'll rob you too!
My job is to cut wood for the Village, but I'm allergic to everything out here! ^Bring me some handkerchiefs and you'll have my thanks.
Hello, PNAME! We're building a new house in town.^If you use your amazing craftsman skills to finish it, we'll give you a reward!
You there! Drop your valuables or else!
Uh-oh. The guards found me!
You say there's a bandit lurking about?^He's probably trying to pickpocket people at the celebration tonight...^If you see him again, I'll send my soldiers to check it out!
Im a baus
All my music blew away in the wind!^I was hired to play music for the celebration of the new house.^I can't play music if my papers are missing!
Thank you so much.^I don't know what I would have done if I lost these music sheets.
I've searched the market everywhere, but I can't find a red bowl!^We need it for the celebration tonight.
Did you make this yourself? It's beautiful.
I need something to feed my son tonight, but I'm a horrible cook!
These smell delicious. Thanks, friend!
All the construction is making too much noise!^And now there's trash all over the streets!
All I have is wet cement, but I need cement blocks!^If you bring me dry cement, I'll trade you for wet cement.
Wonderful! As promised, here is the wet cement.
My stomach is not feeling well. Do you have anything to calm it down?
I feel much better. As thanks, please take this wet cement.
My house is almost complete!^Please, will you finish it for me? I'm not very confident in my skills.
You're a wonderful craftsman! Bless you, PNAME.
I'm donating some of my jewelry to the house owner as a welcome gift!^Do your friends have anything nice they would like to donate?
That was very generous of them. Here's the key to the treasure chest.
You found me!
Is playtime over?
Well done! The streets are clean and it's a beautiful day!
Is it time to go home now?
My shipment of blue dye is late.^Probably because of all this construction. Do you have any dye?
Blue dye is selling very well today. Thanks!
I forgot to ask. Can you pick up the wood chips as well?
Thanks the place looks great
I've been helping with the construction, but I haven't had lunch yet.
This matzo bread is wonderful. Thank you.
I can't find my children! Maybe they are hiding.^I need to take them home. Will you help me search for them?
Thank you, friend! My children are safe!
I'm making apple juice!^Well, I would if I had any apples. Maybe you have some?
The apple juice will be ready soon.^Come by my house when you're finished with the construction.
Good day PNAME. I see you've caught up with our caravan.^We've set up camp but misplaced some items during our travels. ^ I'm certain that the caravan master would greatly appreciate your help!
I'm not budging until someone can find me my food supply. All this traveling and I have not eaten.
Thank you friend. When I lost my food supply I didn't know if I would eat or not.^The caravan master has seen your generosity and would like to speak with you.^He's in the field behind me.
Greetings PNAME. I really appreciate you helping these people out. ^Take this key and talk to my daughter at the end of the camp.

So you are the one my father wants to bless with this Treasure Chest.^While I trust my father's judgment I want to be sure you are not taking advantage of his generosity.^There is a special type of Ceramic Bowl only found in your Hometown.^If you bring me three of them I will know you are who you say you are and I'll give you the key to my father's treasure.

There is no question that you are as genuine as these Ceramic Bowls.^Please forgive me for questioning my father's judgment.^Please PNAME, take this key and receive this Treasure Chest as a token of our gratitude.
Ohh... I seem to have lost my robe. Would you be so kind to help an old man out?
Thank you very much PNAME. Follow the river. I'm sure our driver would like to speak with you.
This area has some beautiful pebbles. I would love to collect some to take to my sisters.
Wow! Thank you so much! My sisters will love these.
I forgot the wine! What am I going to do? I don't think I have time to buy any!
Hey, thanks a lot! ^You should talk to the caravan master, just follow the river.
This place used to look so magnificent. I really wish someone could bring back this area's old beauty.
Incredible! This place looks better than it did before. Thank you.
I'm the caretaker for all the town's orphans. It's time for bed, but I can't find any of them!^I hope they are safe...
Are you lost? You should find your caretaker now.
There you are!
Found you! It's time to go home now.
I'm so hungry... Do you have any apples?
Those apples were so fresh!
At this rate, I'll never finish loading these crates on time.
That was fast! Thanks.
It's getting late. Can you light the lamp stands?
We don't want people bumping into each other during the night.
My shipment of grain is leaving soon. I could use a little help loading the carts.
I'm so glad you are all safe and sound. PNAME, here is the key to the gate.^Feel free to take your reward.
You're a lot stronger than you look. Thanks.
Do you know anything about carpentry? My market stalls fell down in a rainstorm.
Your craftsmanship is amazing.
My cabbages are ruined!
Thank you for picking them up. Maybe they aren't all ruined after all.
There's trash everywhere! Can you help me pick up a bit?
We need to keep our town clean.
This wind is unbearable. My tax forms are all over the place.
You helped me? A tax collector?^Thank you.
My fish are in baskets all over the market. Can you help me finish loading my carts with them?
Go on home now.
Great work! Maybe I'll get off work early today...
I ran out of quill pens. Do your friends have any I can use?
I have enough pens to last a long while.^Here is the key to the treasure chest.
This wind is unbearable. My tax forms are all over the place.
You helped me? A tax collector?^Thank you.
Did you find them yet?
My house is in shambles. Could I have a few bricks to fix the hole in my wall?
Those bricks are perfect. Thank you!
Time for bed. You should head home now.
I found you! Good thing you are safe.
You are good at hiding!
No one can hide from me forever!
Playtime is over for today.
Are you hungry? It's time for dinner.

What a glorious day this is!^We were just told the good news that our sins are forgiven through Yeshua.^Make your way through the forest into the city.^If you help the townspeople while you hear their testimonies we'll give you a big reward!
When I heard that God wanted me to repent from my sins I spent the rest of the day praying.^Now my knees are a little bruised. Do you have any ointment?
This will certainly do the trick. My knees feel better already!
Ever since the worst criminals in the area decided to serve the Lord crime has been down.^So much so I lost my uniform. Can you help me find it?
Thank you friend. Now I can be ready if trouble arises again.

Yeshua wanted us to remember His great sacrifice for us by taking communion.^But none of our silverware is worthy of this ceremony.^If your friends have something useful I will gladly give the key to this treasure chest.
May we never forget the day God gave His Son to pay the penalty for our sins.
My son has been playing for a while but I want him to understand the message we just heard.^Can you call him over for me so we can study the scriptures together?
Thank you dear. I will never stop looking over my son like God will never stop looking over us!
I don't want to go anywhere. Those spiders might bite me!
What happened? The spiders are gone?^Ha! They must have been scared and ran away from me.
Did you hear?! God sent His only Son, Yeshua, to save us from our sins!^Who cares if we only have eggs and vegetables? Help us prepare a celebration meal!
What a great soup. What a great God!
I've done some terrible, unspeakable things in my life.^I don't understand why or how God could overlook my many sins.
So Yeshua lived a sinless life, but came to suffer and die for MY sins?^Why would He do such a thing? ...Unbelievable.
PNAME! I could really use your help.^These boats are wrecked and I can't go fishing without my boats!^Help me repair them and I'll let you pass.
Thank you very much!
If these fish aren't loaded in the carts on time, I'll lose my job!^Can you help?
Thanks! You saved me!
I heard you're a talented craftsman.^Could you make me a ceramic bowl?^I want to give one to my husband for his birthday.
Thanks! He'll love it!
We are having a beach party later and you're invited!^Can you help me light the bonfires?
Remember, the party starts at sunset.
Do you know anyone with a spare trumpet?^I sell them at the market, but I'm out of stock.^I'll give you the key to that chest if you find me some.
These are wonderful. Here's the key!
Wow! You're very talented!^Thanks a lot!
Our town's sundials were destroyed in a terrible storm!^Do you know anyone with a spare sundial?
Thanks! Help yourself to the apples.
The storm damaged my home. Could you help an old man gather stones to repair it?
Thank you PNAME! May El Shaddai bless you for your generosity.
Could you spare any apples? I haven't had lunch yet.
Thanks for the food!
My mother is at home sick today.^I know it would cheer her up if I brought her flowers, but I can't find any!
Someone's trying to turn the townsfolk against a family of visiting Samaritans. ^If nobody steps in, they could be murdered!
I'm ready to kill that other merchant. He is constantly stealing my business.^And now he broke my market stalls!
I fixed your market stalls and filled your carts. ^See, there's enough business for both of you.
They probably just fell over. I see it all the time.^Hatred is as bad as murder. We should forgive each other.
Our husbands have been competing with each other for years, and we're afraid one of them may do something drastic.
I'll see if I can talk some sense into them.
Thank you! They seem much calmer now.
That man over there is ruining all my business!^He knocked over my cabbages when I wasn't looking!
Where's my money? You haven't paid me back in two weeks!
The cabbages probably fell over on their own. I cleaned them up for you.
My fellow Jews, look there and see. The Samaritans are here to steal our valuables and cause mayhem!
Look at these journal entries.^These people are on a trip to visit a sick family member.
The Samaritans worship in the wrong place.^We should stone them for their rebellion against God!
I see...I was mistaken.^I believed the Samaritans were evil, but they are just like us.^I'm so ashamed.
The Samaritans worship the same God as we do. We should treat them as brothers and sisters.
You're right! You'd better go ahead and tell the Samaritans that they're safe now.
Help me destroy weapons, so they can't attack us!
You found it? Hallelujah! See, I told you I lost it.
Thanks for your help! Hopefully that will slow them down for a while.
I seem to have misplaced my robes. Could you find them for me?
My friends need to stand up for themselves. ^Light torches to give the people courage.
Thank you for your help!
My animals are terrified! Help me calm them.
Thank you!
Bless you.
I can't stand fighting!
Nice job breaking up that fight!
Thank you for helping make things right. But I still want to do more. ^Please bring me Olives so I can give them to the Samaritans as an apology.
We're safe now? Thank you for your help!
You are a saint. God bless you!
You saved us all!
Thanks for saving my family!
Those people were scary! Thank you, PNAME.
You were brave to take them on. I only wish I had your courage.
I'm very sorry. I must have misplaced it. I promise!
Thank you for your help! The Lord's favor is upon you.
Thank you!
I can't believe my fellow townsfolk are supporting this madman! ^Bring me trumpets, so I can call the guards!
Thanks! They should be here any minute.
I can't remember my prayers. Can you help me?
Thank you! Now I can pray like David did in the Psalms!
If I don't get it soon, you'll pay with your life!
You were right. I got angry over nothing.^Thanks for helping me out.
I was so busy being angry I didn't even pick them up. Thank you.^I should learn to stop judging my fellow merchant.
Forgive me, I was wrong to hate you.^Thank you for finding my money, PNAME.
No! Don't kill them. The Samaritans are people too.^Please listen. They aren't the enemy.^Don't you remember the Law of Moses?
How could you stand up for a Samaritan? You're a traitor too!
Our flock escaped from the pen this morning.^If you help us gather our sheep, we'll give you a reward.
It's going to be a hot day. Do you have any palm fronds I can use to fan myself?
The fronds should keep me cool in the afternoon.
My flock had a fright this morning and escaped the pen!^Could you help me gather them?
I'm so happy my sheep are all safe!
My cabbages fell down the hill!
Thanks for the help. I'm not feeling well this morning.
I'm very busy with my morning chores. Please water the horses.
The horses are very important to our farm work. We need to make sure they are cared for.
Could you bring me a few chicken eggs for breakfast?
These will make a wonderful omelet!
I build boats for a living, but I ran out of resin!
I'll be in the vineyard picking grapes today. Can you find the grape baskets?
I'm off to the vineyard!
It's summer now. I'll be planting new crops soon.^Do you know anyone with spare seeds?
The seeds are very fresh. Thank your friends for me!
This resin is a crucial part of making the boat waterproof!
The children in the town close by are very hungry.^Would you mind donating bread to feed them?
I'm sure the children will be very happy to eat something today.^God bless you!
I'm so sluggish in the morning. I need breakfast!
Wonderful! Now I'm full of energy!
I have valuables I'm sending to a friend.^I need sawdust to pad the inside of the crate^so they don't break on the journey.
This sawdust is very soft. My friend will love the gifts I'm sending!
I need to lock these tools away so the kids don't get hurt.
I need a bowl to present my fresh fruit for my business.
My business will thrive with my fruit displayed in such a beautiful red bowl!
I'm catching butterflies to pass the time. Want to join me?
Butterflies remind me that God's beauty is everywhere, and He made it for us!
I can't walk through here with all these snakes!
Praise God you were here. The town can't afford a gardener anymore.
I handle the town leader's taxes, but the forms have scattered in the wind!
Thank you for returning those forms to the cart!^I won't forget this.
I've been out of work since no more trade comes through town.^Do you have any food?
Our river town has not been doing well since the Romans built the highway.^If you help us fix the place up, the town leader will give you our treasure.
This soup will last me for a few days. You've given me hope, stranger.
You've been a great help to my town, PNAME.^I need one last thing. My shepherds need new trumpets.
Your friends have just the trumpets I need. Thank you.^Here is the key to my treasure chest.
My father has lost his job and we have too much debt!^Please help!
Hooray! God really cares about me!^Thank you for helping us through this hard time.
My dessert at home needs something to add to the flavor.^Can you get me some lemons?
With these Lemons, my dessert will be a lot more interesting. Thanks!
I need to find my way home in the dark tonight, but I don't have a lamp!
You're a lifesaver! Thanks for the lamp.
A band of musicians is coming to town, but I lost the shipment of harps they ordered!
I'm exhausted from fishing all night. I still need to load the catch into my cart.
Your friends are a real blessing.
You have a special way of making everyone feel important. Thank you.
I haven't caught any fish lately. Can you spare any alms?
Your kindness has reminded me of God's love and provision. Bless you.
I don't have any servants now that business is slow. Can you help me take down the dried fish?
Thanks. I'll let the town leader know you helped out.
Some children played with my tools and left them everywhere!
PNAME, I was wondering if you could help me?^I was asked to gather pebbles by the mason so he could fix the walls.
The guests will be arriving soon!^Help me clear out the trash and dead logs.
Thank you PNAME! Now hurry along, I think the master is nearby.
UGH! I'm so hungry, I need to get this sack to the kitchen.^PNAME, can you please bring me some pomegranates?
Thanks that really hit the spot. I'm off!
Oh dear! I need olives for the kitchen, and I don't know where to look.^PNAME do you have any?
Thanks! The master is waiting for you just behind me. I'm off to the kitchen.
Well done, PNAME. I have a treasure chest for you.^I'll give you the key if you will put garlands on my horses for me.
As promised. Here is your key.
Hi PNAME. I'm on watering duty today.^Do you have any watering cans?
These are hard times. That was very generous, stranger.
Thanks. Now I can get back to my job.
The master wants a new robe. And I was asked to get some blue dye.^Could I trouble you for some?
Thanks! This is a splendid color.
Hi, thanks for coming. Before I let you through to the rest of the garden,^can you please go back and put bows on the sheep in the pen?
Thanks, I have other flocks I need to attend to now.
Hi PNAME, I need to ask for a huge favor. Can you help me tend these saplings?^I need to get them ready for the party.
Thanks PNAME, you're a life saver.
I'm looking for a cooking knife.^I was asked to help cook but I can't get started without a knife.
Thanks! This will help a lot.
PNAME, our caravan is running late. If you help us load the donkeys, we'll give you a reward.
I found you!
There you are! Your mother is looking for you.
Are you lost?
Please load the donkeys with cargo from my market stalls.
Thank you so much! My caravan will leave as soon as possible!
I'm a maker of fine wines. I'd like to sample the grapes from this town.
These grapes may not be what I'm looking for.^A good wine requires a special kind of grape.
Please find my children! I've looked everywhere.
You found them! Bless you, friend.
I was sunburned while I swam in the lake. Do you have any ointment I could borrow?
I need these nets cleaned before I can go fishing this afternoon.
My skin feels much better thanks to your ointment.
I need new clothes for a party. But the tailor has no more cloth!
This cloth is exactly what I need!
My pots fell out of my cart! Can you help me pick them up?
Bless you! You were a big help.
That was fast! Excellent work!
It's so hot, and it's not even lunchtime!
Thank you for the palm fronds. Now I can cool off.
I'm in a hurry and I need my carts loaded with fish.
Thanks a lot, stranger.
I need kindling for a fire to make tonight's dinner. Is there any sawdust around?
This sawdust is perfectly dry! Dinner will be delicious.
Help us bring in the harvest and we'll share a Reward with you!
You'll need herbs if you want to bake matzo! I saw a few growing outside.
These look tasty! ^ Here's a key to the Kitchen.
Nice work with those donkeys! ^ This shipment will make me a good profit at the market. ^ If you can find olives for me to sell, I'll give you this gold key!
I had a hunch that you could help me. ^ Here's your key!
Our wagons got damaged on the way here! ^ Help us repair them so we can get moving again.
Thanks! Those Carts look good as new!
Can you help me expand our wheat field? ^ Clear these dead trees so that next year's harvest will be even bigger! ^ Get rid of those trees and I'll let you pass.
Thanks for your help!
Thanks! Now bake this wheat in the ovens and we'll take it to Market.
Can you help me pick flowers for my friend?
Thanks! ^ She was having a bad day, but these will cheer her up!
These traders are leaving soon, but they can't leave until the matzo bread is loaded.^Hurry and bake the bread in the ovens!
Great work! That matzo smells delicious.
Those traders made a big mess when we let them inside! ^ Help me clean the floor, and I'll give you the key to the Kitchen.
Thanks for your help, the place looks much cleaner now!^You can use the Kitchen now. Don't burn yourself!
Help me load and water the donkeys. ^ We have to make it back to the market before this food spoils!
Thanks for your help! ^ Here's a key to the storage shed—go take your payment!

Hello, PNAME. Welcome to our town Synagogue!^I'm having a lot of trouble. No one wants to come hear today's Shabbat teaching. And everyone is busy working on Shabbat!^Please help everyone enjoy Shabbat and stop working!
Can you spare any alms? I need to feed my family!
Bless you, PNAME! You're an answer to my prayer.
I can't go into the Synagogue with all the spiders crawling about!
Oh, they're gone? Well, then I better go hear today's teaching.
How can you say there isn't a resurrection? It's in the Scriptures!
Look in Ezekiel. He prophesied that one day all the dry bones of the Jews would come back to life!
We're about to listen to the Shabbat teaching. You're invited.
Now that my donkeys are fed, the rest of my day is free.^Let's get going!
Did you know the Rabbi is calling everyone to hear the Shabbat teaching?
Thanks for the help, PNAME.^I need to stop worrying and go listen to the teaching.
Before we gather everyone, I require the silver scrolls.^I think the other Rabbi has a key to the silver scroll room.
Tradition says I can't enter the Synagogue until I wash my hands.^Can you bring me some water?
Perfect! Now my hands are ceremonially clean. I'll see you at the Synagogue!
I've never read anything convincing me that there is an afterlife.
I'll prove it! PNAME, can you bring me the scrolls from the scroll rooms?
Can't we agree to disagree? It's time for the Shabbat teaching.
You have a good point, but that's from the prophets.^What about the Books of Moses?
We can talk more about this later.^But I'm still not convinced!
I know it's Shabbat, but I really need to feed my donkeys!^I forgot to do it last night.
I'd like to come, but I'm busy feeding my sheep for the morning!
The Rabbi is about to start his teaching. Come listen with me!
You found them? Great! Now we just need everyone to show up.^Please gather everyone here for the teaching.
Those apples were wonderful!^Spending time with friends at the Synagogue doesn't sound so bad.
I can't be bothered right now. I need some breakfast.
You need a key for the silver scroll room?^You can have mine, but first light all the Shabbat torches outside.

Thank you, PNAME. After the teaching, you may take your reward from the treasure chest.^Today's teaching comes from the Scroll of Exodus:^"I will rain down bread from Heaven for you. Gather each day what you need for that day."
Beautiful! Our torches will shine all through the night.^Here is the key you needed.
My library doesn't have some of the scrolls I need for my studies.^Could you ask your friends for some?
Your friends were a big help. Thank them for the scriptures.^Here's the key to the treasure chest.
Hello, PNAME. If you help out around the harbor, you can have our treasure chest.
The sand crabs are crowding the beach!
I could really use something to eat.
I'm in charge of unloading cargo from the boats into these carts.^But I'm already tired! Can you help?
The harbor is infested with rats. Why don't we set up some traps?
I can't find any merchants to sell me fried fish. I haven't had breakfast either.
I can't catch fish with my boat in this condition. Please help me fix it!
My friends are coming, but I don't have time to prepare dinner!
These horses need to eat before they take the carts to the city.^There should be some grain around here...
Great work! It's a lot easier to walk around now.
That was delicious!
Hooray! You saved me a lot of time. Thank you.
The rats are gone! Good riddance.
These are delicious. You're a great cook!
You fixed it! Now I can feed my family!
This is going to be some great stew!^I'll take it from here.
My horses are to ready to leave. Great work.
I've never fished before, but I wanted to try it out.^Do you have any fish hooks?
Thank your friends for the fish hooks.^Here, you can have the key to the treasure chest.
I came here for a day at the beach, but I forgot my lunch!
This will be a wonderful lunch for a day at the beach.
Hello! I'm the guide!
Hi, mop the floor please
Thx for mopping!
Hi i need you to craft something lol
Thx for crafting that!
We need to plant crops over there, cut down that tall grass please!
Thanks for cutting the grass
Hi I need some viral thing
Thanks for the viral thing
Hi I need veggies so I can make dinner
dust the sculptures for me!
Thx for teh veggies!
I think I need Matzo Bread xD
Thx for the matzo bread?
Help me set up the flower stands
Thx for helping with the flowers
Thx for dusting the sculptures!
Help me fill up the glass cart!
Thx for helping with the glass cart!
I need red dye for a tapestry I'm creating.^If you brought me some, I'd give you a silver key.
This is the perfect shade of red! Here's the key.
Hi, I need scrolls
Thx for finding the scrolls!

Unlock the Next Area
The carpenters's workshop was destroyed in the fire.^Let's unlock the next area!
Nice work, PNAME. Why don't you check on the carpenter for me?^He could use some comfort.
Clear the Air
The Carpenter's Workshop is still covered in smoke! Use Fellowship to clear the air.
Click on the Carpenter to get started
Clear out the Smoke with Fellowship!
It's nice to meet you, PNAME.^We need to clear the smoke before I can rebuild.
It's completely ruined! It's so hard to start over...
Ask Around
The Carpenter needs help tearing down his ruined Workshop. Recruit Friends to help!
Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Great Job! Your Friends are awesome!
Get NEED Friends to volunteer
I feel like nobody cares about what happened.^I can't rebuild my workshop all alone!
Wow! I'm impressed so many people volunteered.
Porridge Power
The Carpenter needs a balanced breakfast before starting construction. Make him Porridge!
Prepare Porridge in your Cottage!
Prepare Porridge for the Carpenter
Have anything to share for breakfast?^I can't work on an empty stomach.
That was delightful! You're a fantastic cook!
Tear down the Burned Workshop so you can rebuild it from the bottom up.
Click on the Carpenter's Workshop to get started. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Tear down the Burned Workshop
We can't rebuild until the old place is torn down...^Let's get started.
I have such good memories of this place.^It's a shame to see it go.
Brick by Brick
Restore the ground floor with Bricks!
Craft Bricks in the Workshop
Craft NEED Bricks
I'm setting the floor with bricks. Do you have any spares?
I can't wait to get started!
Building Blocks
Craft Cement Blocks for the Carpenter's new Workshop.
Craft Cement Blocks in the Workshop. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Craft NEED Cement Blocks
The walls will be made of cement blocks.^Could you make me a few?
These cement blocks are very precise! Well done, PNAME.
Lay the Foundation
Gather materials and lay the foundation for the new Carpenter's Workshop.
Click on the's Carpenter's Workshop to get started. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Great! A bold first move!
Set the foundation for the Workshop
I'm so excited! I'll finally have a job again.
I wish my son was still alive...^He would have loved to see the new workshop...
Health Insurance

Craft Splints in the Workshop. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Craft NEED Splints
One of the volunteers is injured!^They need splints to set the bone straight!
This reminds me of when my son broke his leg...^I really miss him.
Pomegranate Jam
It's snack time! Make Pomegranate Jam for the volunteers.
Make Pom Jam in the Oven. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Make Pomegranate Jam
My wife made bread for the volunteers.^Have any jam to go with it?
This is delicious jam!
Day by Day
You're making progress! Construct the next stage of the new Carpenter's Workshop.
Click on the Carpenter's Workshop to get started. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Construct the next stage of the Carpenter's Workshop
I think we're ready for the next step!
I'm starting over, but I'm not sure I'll ever be able to forgive the Romans for killing my son...
Watering Cans
The Carpenter is starting a vegetable garden outside his workshop! Ask for Watering Cans!
Ask Friends for help. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Ask for NEED Watering Cans
Perhaps I should start a vegetable garden.^I always promised my son we would start one.
Your generosity has convicted me, PNAME.^I want to learn to forgive, but I'm in so much pain...
Super Soup
Whip up your famous Vegetable Soup in your Oven for all the volunteers!
Fry Fish in your Oven. Speak to the Mason to complete the Task
Prepare Vegetable Soup
I heard your vegetable soup is the best there is!^Let's prepare some for the volunteers for lunch!
Everyone is raving about your soup!^You're a real blessing to me, PNAME.
The Tree of Life
The Carpenter is puting his faith in God's Tree of Life. Help complete the new Workshop.
Click on the Carpenter's Workshop to get started. Speak to the Carpenter to complete the Task
Complete the Carpenter's Workshop
With this last step, I want to forgive the men who killed my son.^God's way is better than my way.
Thank you for all your support, PNAME.^I've finally been able to let go.^My son wouldn't want me to stay bitter forever.^God is so good to us!
